excerpts: Don't forget to add a fresh squeezed carrot juice chaser.
carrot juice.author: thrasher b.
carrot juice.review:
Two words: Chicken Shwarma -- only available on Tuesday and Friday. 

I order it without onions and and ask for extra hot sauce. Don't forget to add a fresh squeezed carrot juice chaser.

Tip: Early afternoons are the best time to go. If it's crowded, you'll feel cramped and you won't enjoy it.

I'm a regular and I've been going here for years. The owner has a good memory and always remembers what I like, before I open my mouth.

Is it the absolute best? Most likely not, but you'll walk away satisfied. Sometimes I've eaten here twice in one day. It's really that good.

excerpts: Three falafels and a carrot juice for under $4?
You just found yourself a healthy adult happy meal-sized snack.
carrot juice.author: JayBee L.
carrot juice.review: MISSION--I wish these guys would open a sit-down joint. It's the best of its kind that I've found anywhere nearby. Great for on the go. The falafel is exquisite. Tip: an off-menu item, it can be ordered  a la cart. Three falafels and a carrot juice for under $4? You just found yourself a healthy adult happy meal-sized snack.

excerpts: Excellent fresh carrot juice
carrot juice.author: Paige B.
carrot juice.review:
Best Chicken Shawarma in the city! (But they only have chicken Tuesdays and Fridays- so really 4.5 stars but I rounded up...)  And the hot sauce they add is amazing- full of so much flavor, but not super spicy!

This is the only falafel, I'll eat!  Moist and flavorful, never dry and bland.

Excellent fresh carrot juice, they make it when you order it.

mmmm, mouth watering!

excerpts: Fresh squeezed carrot juice.
The tough lass that works the register is sweet; she brought my carrot juice.
I love middle eastern food and their falafel, hummus, dolmas etc. are great but well be shore to calm bakk on thair she-warma dais.
I was going to ask the owner about the nationalities of the singers whose cds he sells (he sells cds!)
but I didn't.
Next time.
I should be up on my Arabic pop.
carrot juice.author: Mark G.
carrot juice.review:
Stripped down, almost utilitarian culinary rock and rai. Lucky I passed by on a Friday 'cause it was chicken shewarma day and g-damnfuck was it good (love the hot sauce), and held me for hours. Fresh squeezed carrot juice. 

The tough lass that works the register is sweet; she brought my carrot juice. I love middle eastern food and their falafel, hummus, dolmas etc. are great but well be shore to calm bakk on thair she-warma dais. I was going to ask the owner about the nationalities of the singers whose cds he sells (he sells cds!)  but I didn't. Next time. I should be up on my Arabic pop. Shukran.

Natural light: Good

excerpts: They take credit cards, and for hummus, a shwarma, and carrot juice, I paid about $15.
I guess that with so many amazing mediterranean places (see Sunrise Deli)
I'm just not up for settling.
carrot juice.author: Jared F.
carrot juice.review: Just so so.  This isn't a restaurant, it's a mediterranean on the go place.  The chicken shwarma was a little low on the garlic and the hummus was just ok.  They take credit cards, and for hummus, a shwarma, and carrot juice, I paid about $15.  I guess that with so many amazing mediterranean places (see Sunrise Deli) I'm just not up for settling.

excerpts: Also had the freshly made carrot juice.
Delicious!
Parking can be a challenge.
Best to take the BART and walk over.
Get carry out unless you like cozy restaurant spaces.
Spicy is mild or go non-spicy, if you like.
carrot juice.author: Cindy M.
carrot juice.review: Best chicken shawarma I've ever had!  The meat was tender, not dry, the sauces flavorful, but not runny. Also had the freshly made carrot juice. Delicious!  Parking can be a challenge.  Best to take the BART and walk over.  Get carry out unless you like cozy restaurant spaces.  Spicy is mild or go non-spicy, if you like.

excerpts: Fresh squeezed carrot juice and their signature garlic yogurt drinks are great in the summer!
I have yet to try their desserts (baklava assortments)
but for $1-2
it's hard to go wrong.
Great value and a quick stop option
when you're in a hurry or
even suffering that late night snack attack after a few drinks at the bar.
The staff are super friendly and they always have the best 80's and dance beats blasting in their hardly 120 square ft establishment.
In/Outside seating for 6-10, great for take out!
Caution, the wraps tend to be loaded with tahini watch for the spill.
carrot juice.author: Akash D.
carrot juice.review: This lil gem really gets a 3.5, being in the heart of the Mission it's a regular spot for my girlfriend and I, we often get the combo platter but you can order their falafels by the piece which are fresh moist and steamy on the inside yet crispy on the outside.  Each time we go she insists we get half a dozen drizzled with their hot sauce, tahini and a pile of parsley sprigs.  On Tuesdays and Fridays they have the chicken and lamb shawarmas available Tues/Fri straight off that vertical rotating grill (that i'm sure has a proper name).  I like the fact that they use the thinner pita wraps and pop them on the grill for a light toasting after the wrap is made. Fresh squeezed carrot juice and their signature garlic yogurt drinks are great in the summer!  I have yet to try their desserts (baklava assortments) but for $1-2 it's hard to go wrong.  Great value and a quick stop option when you're in a hurry or even suffering that late night snack attack after a few drinks at the bar.  The staff are super friendly and they always have the best 80's and dance beats blasting in their hardly 120 square ft establishment. In/Outside seating for 6-10, great for take out! Caution, the wraps tend to be loaded with tahini watch for the spill.

excerpts: And if you're on a date or plan to go on one within a month, avoid the garlic mint yogurt drink.
It's deadly.
garlic mint yogurt drink.author: Joanna M.
garlic mint yogurt drink.review:
In college I studied abroad in Switzerland and more or less had a great experience.

While there I became intimately acquainted with the following, in chronological order:

1.) Fondue
2.) My expanding ass after eating said fondue
3.) Poverty after spending a lot of my money on fondue and new clothes from awesome Zurich boutiques to accommodate that ass.

After all this, I ditched the cheese and began eating falafel, shawerma, and kebabs because I could afford it, there were FIVE shawerma places to choose from on my block, and, most importantly, I get giddy at the sight of meat spinning in windows.  And thus we became intimately acquainted. (Hi Ömer!)  Upon return to the states, I swore off fondue (still can't do it) but I bemoaned the lack of shawerma in SF until a date introduced me to Truly Med.  

Now I stop by every few weeks, and while I miss my favorite spots in Zurich and Berlin, Truly Med does a fantastic kefta kebab, lamb shawerma, and good ol' falafel for when you want those cute clothes to fit right.  And if you're on a date or plan to go on one within a month, avoid the garlic mint yogurt drink. It's deadly.

excerpts: The garlic mint yogurt drink was cool and good but more garlicky than the ones you get in the Middle East.
garlic mint yogurt drink.author: Piper W.
garlic mint yogurt drink.review: Loved this. Tried the lamb and falafel wraps and both were excellent. Also tried the plate which was delicious. The hot sauce is good. The garlic mint yogurt drink was cool and good but more garlicky than the ones you get in the Middle East. The pistachio baklava were fresh tasting and very good- not so sweet that your tongue burns. The only thing I wish I got were some beets!!! I guess you have to ask for them???

excerpts: Next time, extra eggplant and no potatoes.
extra eggplant.author: Tracey A.
extra eggplant.review:
No lie: I loved this Chicken Shawerma as much as I enjoyed my dinner at French Laundry a few months earlier.  I'm not even gonna  calculate how many Chicken Shawerma's I could get (a lifetime's, perhaps?) for the price of that single meal.  

Peruse the simple menu posted on the wall, order while standing in line, wait at the bar stools, then take your hot, delicious Middle Eastern sandwich somewhere lovely to enjoy it, as sitting in one of the 2 tables out front will only give you a front row seat to the passing craziness of humanity (?) that is 16th Street.

Before sending you on your way with your bagful (under $20 for 2 dinner-sized sandwiches + 2 waters), they roast that baby on the grill, sealing in warmth and goodness from the outside in.  

The Chicken Shawerma was perfect.  The Falafel Deluxe, a lavash-enrobed falafel with roasted eggplant and potatoes, a wee bit less perfect (too many potatoes).  Next time, extra eggplant and no potatoes.

And there will be a next time, most def'.

excerpts: The falafel regular was really good.
Order it mildly spicy (the guy will ask you) because it really adds to the whole wrap.
The falafels inside were moist and flavorful.
And the sauce.
The sauce was delicious.
Great little place to get some hearty food.
Also the people working there are nice!
falafel regular.author: Anya L.
falafel regular.review: The falafel regular was really good. Order it mildly spicy (the guy will ask you) because it really adds to the whole wrap. The falafels inside were moist and flavorful. And the sauce. The sauce was delicious. Great little place to get some hearty food. Also the people working there are nice!

excerpts: So then I decided to order a spicy falafel regular.
falafel regular.author: Kevin C.
falafel regular.review:
A small hole in the wall with a couple of bar stools.

I wanted to try their chicken shawarma, but it was only available on Tues and Fri. So then I decided to order a spicy falafel regular. The wrap was a pretty good size with just enough ingredients and tahini sauce so that I wouldn't make a mess on my pants. 

Definitely would go back next time to try the shawarmas.

excerpts: The first time I went, I ordered the "Falafel Deluxe," which is a "Falafel Regular" but with eggplant and potatoes.
I don't really like eggplant
I got the Falafel Regular on my second trip, which I liked better.
Good falafel, nice diced cucumber mix, and tasty tzaziki sauce.
Next time I need to try the garlic mint yoghurt drink.
falafel regular.author: Adam B.
falafel regular.review:
Solid Mediterranean food. The first time I went, I ordered the "Falafel Deluxe," which is a "Falafel Regular" but with eggplant and potatoes. I don't really like eggplant and I find potatoes in my wrap to be out of place, but I'm a sucker for anything labeled "Deluxe" or "Supreme" or the like (in other words, I'm American).

I got the Falafel Regular on my second trip, which I liked better. Good falafel, nice diced cucumber mix, and tasty tzaziki sauce. Next time I need to try the garlic mint yoghurt drink.

excerpts: Falafel Regular is the best thing they have.
So delicious.
5 stars for their Falafel Regular!!
falafel regular.author: Wakaknee J.
falafel regular.review:
My favorite falafel in the city. 
Falafel Regular is the best thing they have. So delicious.
Shawarma, both Lamb and Chicken, are not that great .

5 stars for their Falafel Regular!!

excerpts: I always get the falafel regular, extra spicy, because it's not really that hot.
falafel regular.author: Andrew S.
falafel regular.review:
Consistently delicious!  This is absolutely my go-to place when I'm ravenous and in no mood to wait more than a couple minutes.  I always get the falafel regular, extra spicy, because it's not really that hot.  They wrap it in lavash and then grill it which makes their falafel wrap superior to others.  

Kabobs take a while because they grill them fresh to order.  I always see people in there waiting for kebabs.  The shawerma always looks and smells awesome, whether its chicken or lamb (it depends on the day.) I tried the garlic, yogurt & mint drink last time I was there.  It was great, not salty (I just don't dig the salty ones) but it was pretty garlicy.  Seriously, you would not want to have an important meeting or date later in the day, but it was tasty.

excerpts: I get the falafel regular, extra spicy, because it's really not that hot.
falafel regular.author: Tina D.
falafel regular.review:
Consistently delicious!  This is absolutely my go-to place when I'm ravenous and in no mood to wait more than a couple minutes.  I get the falafel regular, extra spicy, because it's really not that hot.  They wrap it in lavash and then grill it which, in my opinion, is the mark of a quality med wrap.

Kabobs take a while because they grill them fresh to order.  I always see people in there waiting for kebabs.  They serve either chicken or lamb shawerma depending on the day (I'll report back on which days are which.)  I tried the garlic, yogurt & mint drink last time I was there.  It was great, not salty (I just don't dig the salty ones) but it was pretty garlicy.  Seriously, you would not want to have an important meeting or date later in the day, but it was tasty.

excerpts: The only good thing about my falafel regular was the thin lavash wrap.
The interior had flavorless & not-recently-prepped cucumbers, a sauce that I basically couldn't taste, & worst of all, precooked & flavorless falafel.
I was begrudgingly handed hot sauce which didn't improve the situation.
The service was off-putting & the space not terribly clean.
Many foodstuffs sitting around in bins.
No option for getting a small amount of hummus to hopefully pep up the sad falafel.
I sure would like to find some good falafel around here.

falafel regular.review: The only good thing about my falafel regular was the thin lavash wrap.  The interior had flavorless & not-recently-prepped cucumbers, a sauce that I basically couldn't taste, & worst of all, precooked & flavorless falafel.  I was begrudgingly handed hot sauce which didn't improve the situation.   The service was off-putting & the space not terribly clean.  Many foodstuffs sitting around in bins. excerpts: The falafel deluxe with eggplant is so bomb as well as the falafels with spicy sauce are to die for!
I never feel guilty eating here as it feels you up quick especially the veggie wraps I can never finish a while wrap

Walk down to Dolores park or enjoy the food from the comfort of your home.
The guys here are very friendly and always make sure you leave happy with a little falafel sample.
Doesn't get better to snack while you wait!

falafel deluxe.review: Amazing falafels and chicken shawarma wraps! If your in the mood for something healthy or even vegetarian stop by truly Mediterranean! I never feel guilty eating here as it feels you up quick especially the veggie wraps I can never finish a while wrap so I always save half for later. Call for pick up since parking is tough here or walk down and order to go. Indoor dining space is limited so great to order and on you go. Walk down to Dolores park or enjoy the food from the comfort of your home. The guys here are very friendly and always make sure you leave happy with a little falafel sample. they have chicken instead of lamb.

My veggie friends and I love them. Tuesdays and Fridays they have chicken instead of lamb. Wife loves that. Would give 5 stars if eating space were larger and if they offered chicken and lamb everyday.

Eating in the rain in line, what more can one ask for, a seat perhaps.

falafel deluxe.review: It really helps to be located next to Roxie,  so convenient.   Dash in and dash back in line for documentary about climate change with dicaprio.  Had the wonderful falafel deluxe, difference is the added eggplant  (why are they called eggplant?) And french fries inside.  It's a two meal portion size. Hummus inside was great, mildly spicy. Eating in the rain in line, what more can one ask for, a seat perhaps.

falafel deluxe.review: It's a small space but it has seats. I got the falafel deluxe because it has eggplants. excerpts: Had the Kufta combo and the falafel deluxe and let me tell you I've been around the world and this is by far my favorite spot for middle eastern food.
I will be living here eventually!
Thanks for the great fresh delicious food.
falafel deluxe.author: Bryan M.
falafel deluxe.review: Don't know where to start but OH MY GOD!!! This place is HEAVEN!!! Literally the best wraps and combos. Had the Kufta combo and the falafel deluxe and let me tell you I've been around the world and this is by far my favorite spot for middle eastern food. I will be living here eventually! Thanks for the great fresh delicious food.

excerpts: I know what falafel is and by far i'm in love with the Falafel Deluxe...
falafel deluxe.author: Tareq M.
falafel deluxe.review:
Amaaaaaaaaaazing Falafel... I know what falafel is and by far i'm in love with the Falafel Deluxe... No way I will walk by this place even if im not hungry and not grab a falafel sandwich. 

Good job guys, pls keep it up :)

excerpts: "Oh, a falafel deluxe?
A falafel deluxe.
The falafel deluxe is good.
Almost as good as the old super falafel.
The hummus is really good.
falafel deluxe.author: John S.
falafel deluxe.review:
What's a guy gotta do to get a decent super falafel around here?  

Back in the day, I would walk to Haight Street and get a super falafel from Ali Baba's Cave (RIP--that location only).  Ali Baba's Cave "changed"--heavy scare quotes mine and intentional as all hell--into Al-Fanoose (RIP), but the super falafel didn't change.  Al-Fanoose closed.  I was sad.

I went to King of Falafil/Falafel, and I love that place, but its super falafel isn't as good as Ali Baba's Cave's/Al-Fanoose's was, plus it's in no way convenient for me to stop there on the way home from work, unless I intentionally get off BART too early, take a 38R, and walk UP A HILL and IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION from my place.

I went to the original Ali Baba's Cave a couple of times after that, but it's just not that convenient either, despite how flat the Mission generally is.  Then I remembered long-forgotten Truly Med.

Yes, Truly Med of the days when plain-wrap mechanic's garages had design studios hidden in them but before the days of said hidden design studios advertising their existence as design studios and, thus, blowing their cover and jacking up their and the nearby rents and pushing out mom-and-pop stores and poor people of color because what San Francisco needs is more white people who make too much money and don't pay enough taxes or attention to the rich history of where they now live, let alone to their surroundings, right?

Yes, I walked into Truly Mediterranean and ordered a super falafel, and you know what the guy said?

"A what?"

Me:  "A super falafel."

Him:  "We only have one size of falafel.  It's big."

"No, a super falafel, with eggplant and potatoes in it."

"Oh, a falafel deluxe?"

"Sure.  A falafel deluxe."

The falafel deluxe is good.  Almost as good as the old super falafel.  The hummus is really good.  Sadly, I also know that they deliver.

What's a guy gotta do to get a decent super falafel around here?  Much more than he used to, apparently.

excerpts: For my evening lunch, I had the Falafel Deluxe wrap.
For $8.25, I get six halves of fresh falafel balls with grilled vegetables, eggplants and a tangy tzatziki white sauce blanketed in a grilled lavash flatbread.
Size-wise, this treat could be "truly" mistaken to my usual burrito with the same bulky size.
With every key ingredients combine in one, I actually enjoyed this treat.
falafel deluxe.author: Matt G.
falafel deluxe.review:
Truly Mediterranean is "truly" a great spot for late night eats. Whether you are out with friend(s) or like me, working the swing shift, "truly" one of the authentic Mediterranean spots in the area. 

For my evening lunch, I had the Falafel Deluxe wrap. For $8.25, I get six halves of fresh falafel balls with grilled vegetables, eggplants and a tangy tzatziki white sauce blanketed in a grilled lavash flatbread. Size-wise, this treat could be "truly" mistaken to my usual burrito with the same bulky size. With every key ingredients combine in one, I actually enjoyed this treat. The unique treat is something different.

"Truly" this is a great spot on 16th Street for late night eats. 

Btw, "Truly" is my "word of the day"!

Like many of you "truly" give a crap!

excerpts: And I went for it.. the falafel Deluxe.
Boy, it was humongo!
A slab of their spicy sauce, diced cucumbers, giant slices of eggplant, thick cuts of fried potatoes and crunchy falafel all rolled into a toasted lavash.
It was scrumptious!
But next time, I'm going to skip the deluxe and just order the regular because the eggplant and potatoes didn't do much for me.
And did I mention it's humongous?
The lamb shwarma was also very flavorful but lacked veggie crunchiness, I'll ask them to add cucumbers next time.
falafel deluxe.author: Jamie M.
falafel deluxe.review:
I'll preface this review with a little story. BF was relentless in his rendition of the orbit commercial (in which a giant falafel comes in the elevator between two people:  "We built this city...... Falafel!") on our way to Truly Mediterranean. Originally, I was going to get the lamb shwarma but after all that, I figured what the heck.. Falafel!

And I went for it.. the falafel Deluxe. Boy, it was humongo! A slab of their spicy sauce, diced cucumbers, giant slices of eggplant, thick cuts of fried potatoes and crunchy falafel all rolled into a toasted lavash. It was scrumptious! But next time, I'm going to skip the deluxe and just order the regular because the eggplant and potatoes didn't do much for me. And did I mention it's humongous? 
The lamb shwarma was also very flavorful but lacked veggie crunchiness, I'll ask them to add cucumbers next time.

excerpts: The Falafel Deluxe, a lavash-enrobed falafel with roasted eggplant and potatoes, a wee bit less perfect (too many potatoes).

falafel deluxe.review:
No lie: I loved this Chicken Shawerma as much as I enjoyed my dinner at French Laundry a few months earlier.  I'm not even gonna  calculate how many Chicken Shawerma's I could get (a lifetime's, perhaps?) for the price of that single meal.  

Peruse the simple menu posted on the wall, order while standing in line, wait at the bar stools, then take your hot, delicious Middle Eastern sandwich somewhere lovely to enjoy it, as sitting in one of the 2 tables out front will only give you a front row seat to the passing craziness of humanity (?) that is 16th Street.

Before sending you on your way with your bagful (under $20 for 2 dinner-sized sandwiches + 2 waters), they roast that baby on the grill, sealing in warmth and goodness from the outside in.

excerpts: Loved the falafel deluxe per my cousin's recommendation on our Mission jaunt.
Wish I was staying longer to try more food here!
Customer service was great, too.
falafel deluxe.author: Sunashine K.
falafel deluxe.review: Loved the falafel deluxe per my cousin's recommendation on our Mission jaunt. Wish I was staying longer to try more food here! Customer service was great, too.

excerpts: Holy cow, I'm still thinking about that falafel deluxe.
She's the one that got away, guys.
They win awards for their falafel.
They have perfected it.
The roasted eggplant in the falafel deluxe really adds a nice touch, though what really does it for me is that after it's all wrapped up, they throw it on a grill so that it's crispy and perfect.
falafel deluxe.author: K M.
falafel deluxe.review:
Best Mediterranean food of my life. What they do is... art.

After too many double IPAs next door at Gestalt, Truly is there for you. Holy cow, I'm still thinking about that falafel deluxe. She's the one that got away, guys. They win awards for their falafel. They have perfected it. The roasted eggplant in the falafel deluxe really adds a nice touch, though what really does it for me is that after it's all wrapped up, they throw it on a grill so that it's crispy and perfect.

Take it to Dolores and think about how great life is until you're done eating it.

Mediterranean food is now ruined for me. Nothing will ever be able to compare to Truly.

excerpts: We ordered the lamb shawarma and falafel deluxe, both with the 'hot' sauce option.
My girlfriend isn't a huge fan of 'hot' food, but she felt this sauce gave both a very subtle, but nice, level of heat, so don't be scared off by it.
The falafel sandwich was rich and nutty with sesame aspects.
They also use fava beans in their falafel, in addition to chickpeas, which added more complexity.
The 'deluxe' falafel has eggplant and potatoes added, which makes it very rich and filling.
falafel deluxe.author: Daniel S.
falafel deluxe.review:
We ordered the lamb shawarma and falafel deluxe, both with the 'hot' sauce option. My girlfriend isn't a huge fan of 'hot' food, but she felt this sauce gave both a very subtle, but nice, level of heat, so don't be scared off by it. The falafel sandwich was rich and nutty with sesame aspects. They also use fava beans in their falafel, in addition to chickpeas, which added more complexity. The 'deluxe' falafel has eggplant and potatoes added, which makes it very rich and filling. The lamb was very good, too with nice seasoning and not too fatty. 

All in all, we we're very happy and it was reasonably priced. Very much of a takeout place. Only complaint was they didn't have pickled hot peppers, which I felt was missing as a foil to the richness of both sandwiches.

excerpts: I recommend the lamb Swarma and the falafel deluxe.
falafel deluxe.author: Gene L.
falafel deluxe.review: These guysare always so nice! And the food is so delicious! I recommend the lamb Swarma and the falafel deluxe. Also the carrot juice is really sweet.

excerpts: Second favorite is the Falafel Deluxe.
The staff is friendly and they are very fast.
My only wish is that there was more seating but don't let that stop you from giving them a try.
You can always take-out..
falafel deluxe.author: Jay B.
falafel deluxe.review: The Food is the Best..Always fresh. The lamb shawarma is by far my favorite. Second favorite is the Falafel Deluxe. The staff is friendly and they are very fast. My only wish is that there was more seating but don't let that stop you from giving them a try. You can always take-out..

excerpts: When I was there, I went for the gold and got the falafel deluxe.
Like falafel wraps with similar names, this one came with eggplant and potatoes stuff into the wrapped (along with the normal trimmings.)
While it's not the best falafel I've had in San Francisco (that award still goes to Sunrise), I did find that the falafel deluxe at Truly is extremely hearty.
falafel deluxe.author: Jon T.
falafel deluxe.review:
I love a good falafel wrap. Also love good, friendy service. Truly Mediterranean has both.

When I was there, I went for the gold and got the falafel deluxe. Like falafel wraps with similar names, this one came with eggplant and potatoes stuff into the wrapped (along with the normal trimmings.) While it's not the best falafel I've had in San Francisco (that award still goes to Sunrise), I did find that the falafel deluxe at Truly is extremely hearty. I usually can eat a wrap no problem, but I actually had to save the last quarter portion for later.

There's not a ton of room to eat here, but if it wasn't a chilly night, I probably would have preferred to eat outside somewhere anyway.

Get hot sauce.

excerpts: The falafel deluxe is just as good.
Made with the crispest yet softest falafel.
I continue to come here for the food obviously but the staff just warms my heart.
They are so so so friendly.
They always give complimentary falafel to patrons that are waiting if the wait seems longer than usual.
The owner and his son, the cooks and the nicest African lady that rings me up sometimes.
Everyone looks genuinely happy to work there and that is refreshing.
Always consistent, never fails.
falafel deluxe.author: Tibyan H.
falafel deluxe.review: Best shawarma in town, the lamb always tastes just right. I love that they can add fried potatoes and eggplants into any wrap. The falafel deluxe is just as good. Made with the crispest yet softest falafel. I continue to come here for the food obviously but the staff just warms my heart. They are so so so friendly. They always give complimentary falafel to patrons that are waiting if the wait seems longer than usual. The owner and his son, the cooks and the nicest African lady that rings me up sometimes. Everyone looks genuinely happy to work there and that is refreshing. Always consistent, never fails.

excerpts: We had the Mediterranean Combo & Falafel deluxe.
Quite yummy !
falafel deluxe.author: Hilda D.
falafel deluxe.review: Fearfully and wonderfully made. We had the Mediterranean Combo & Falafel deluxe. Quite yummy !

excerpts: Get the Falafel Deluxe and pay the extra for them to add feta.
The staff is extremely customer friendly and accommodating.
falafel deluxe.author: Tod T.
falafel deluxe.review:
Rather than write a flowery, fluffy review, I'll get right to the point.
There does not exist a better falafel wrap anywhere else and I have searched far and wide. Get the Falafel Deluxe and pay the extra for them to add feta.
The staff is extremely customer friendly and accommodating.

excerpts: For people who have smaller stomachs, one of their schwarma or falafel deluxe wraps will equal two meals!
falafel deluxe.author: Karl B.
falafel deluxe.review:
I have been eating here for 15 years!  I like everything on the menu, but I especially crave their chicken schwarma which is only available on Tuesdays and Fridays. (lamb schwarma the other days).
The prices are not totally cheap considering it is a take out joint, but the taste is stupendous and the portions leave me feeling full.  For people who have smaller stomachs, one of their schwarma or falafel deluxe wraps will equal two meals!

excerpts: so I got the falafel deluxe and boy
I was disappointed.
The potatoes were cold and tasteless.
The eggplants was tasteless too.
The falafel balls were good.
I like this place and will return
but I won't be getting the falafel deluxe again.
I guess I'll be sticking to their combo plate.
falafel deluxe.author: Shaan M.
falafel deluxe.review: I have to been to Truly Mediterranean before and would always get the combo plate but i thought of trying something else from them since it's MY BIRTHDAY today so I got the falafel deluxe and boy I was disappointed. The potatoes were cold and tasteless. The eggplants was tasteless too. The falafel balls were good. I like this place and will return but I won't be getting the falafel deluxe again. I guess I'll be sticking to their combo plate.

excerpts: I got the falafel deluxe which had the addition of potatoes and eggplant.
What I liked about the sandwich was that every element had a distinctive flavor and all of the elements complemented one another very well.
Eating it is that complex barrage of flavors
and it's just delicious.
falafel deluxe.author: Joseph C.
falafel deluxe.review: Truly Mediterranean has the best falafel that I've ever had.  Their sandwiches are fucking amazing and may just be definitive proof that there's a god after all.  I got the falafel deluxe which had the addition of potatoes and eggplant.  What I liked about the sandwich was that every element had a distinctive flavor and all of the elements complemented one another very well.  Eating it is that complex barrage of flavors and it's just delicious.  My partner got the famous lamb shawerma sandwich with the tomatoes that have been cooked in the lamb drippings and he ate it but he seemed disappointed.  I think he wasn't crazy about the sauce that was on it but that might just be him.  Bottom line:  fabulous.

excerpts:
Get the Falafel Deluxe. 
If you are claustrophobic, you might want to go somewhere else.  
Oh so delicious.
falafel deluxe.author: Nick C.
falafel deluxe.review:
Let's keep it short.  Everything that could be said, has been said.

Best falafel I have ever had.  
Get the Falafel Deluxe. 
If you are claustrophobic, you might want to go somewhere else.  
Oh so delicious.

excerpts: Falafel deluxe wrap is comparable to the size of an elfaro burrito.
falafel deluxe.author: Skye W.
falafel deluxe.review:
Falafel deluxe wrap is comparable to the size of an elfaro burrito.

The lamb schwermas don't come with potato and eggplant like the ones at ali baba's cafe, and are smaller, but my bf said they have more meat.

The hot sauce wasn't as hot.

excerpts: I always get the falafel deluxe with hot sauce.
I love that they toast the lavash on the grill after assembly
--makes a huge difference.
Their falafel is always crisp and delicious.
The fried potatoes and eggplant are not greasy, and have a nice "smoky" flavor.
Make sure to get extra feta if you want your tastebuds to sing.
falafel deluxe.author: Antoi C.
falafel deluxe.review:
Everyone loves this place, and I do too. Tiny, yet very tidy, clean space. I always get the falafel deluxe with hot sauce. I love that they toast the lavash on the grill after assembly --makes a huge difference. Their falafel is always crisp and delicious. The fried potatoes and eggplant are not greasy, and have a nice "smoky" flavor. Make sure to get extra feta if you want your tastebuds to sing. Mmmmmm.....

5 stars for the owner's deadpan humor. I love that guy!

excerpts: As for their famed falafel deluxe...
I'm not a huge fan of Falafel (though, it is fun to say...falafel falafel falafel), but heard so much ranting and raving about this place, that I HAD to try it.
It was the best falafel I've ever had...
falafel deluxe.author: Ron C.
falafel deluxe.review:
The chicken schawerma changed my life (in a good way).  'nuff said.

As for their famed falafel deluxe...
I'm not a huge fan of Falafel (though, it is fun to say...falafel falafel falafel), but heard so much ranting and raving about this place, that I HAD to try it.  It was the best falafel I've ever had... but I still hate falafel (falafel falafel).  

I won't dock them stars for that though, it's just not my favorite food.  5*s for quick and polite service, clean (but tiny) facility, and AMAZING chicken schawerma .

excerpts: Next time I want to ask for potatoes and cucumbers inside though cause that's what i love about the falafel deluxe.
falafel deluxe.author: Julie B.
falafel deluxe.review: Just ate here again.... the shawerma is delicious, but you gotta ask for extra hot sauce if you really want it spicy.  It's full of flavor and the flatbread it's wrapped in gets grilled perfectly.  Next time I want to ask for potatoes and cucumbers inside though cause that's what i love about the falafel deluxe.

excerpts: I couldn't take it anymore...the silly wraps were taunting me, so I got my wallet and ordered the falafel deluxe.
No wonder the yelp rating is so high...the toasted wrap with crispy falafels was enhanced by the eggplant flavor.
SUPER YUM!
falafel deluxe.author: Wing Man C.
falafel deluxe.review: Conveniently located a couple doors down from the Roxie, this place has one of the best falafel wraps I've ever tasted. I was skeptical at first while volunteering at the theater for a film festival, but I kept seeing (and SMELLING) the wraps that the people were eating while waiting in line for the films to start.  I couldn't take it anymore...the silly wraps were taunting me, so I got my wallet and ordered the falafel deluxe. No wonder the yelp rating is so high...the toasted wrap with crispy falafels was enhanced by the eggplant flavor.  SUPER YUM!

excerpts: Disappointed to find that there was no lamb schwarma today, I ordered the falafel deluxe, which just come with eggplant and onions included with the falafel wrap option which is another menu item.
The staff is extremely nice and make the wraps large (
falafel deluxe.author: Julia K.
falafel deluxe.review:
This place makes falafels right. WOO!

I really wanted to try the lamb schwarma, but I went on Friday and the only two days that they don't have lamb schwarma is Tuesday and Friday. On those two days they have chicken schwarma instead. 

Disappointed to find that there was no lamb schwarma today, I ordered the falafel deluxe, which just come with eggplant and onions included with the falafel wrap option which is another menu item. The staff is extremely nice and make the wraps large (My guy friends that came with me were all stuffed afterwards..and these guys eat a lot, too). 

The restaurant itself is rather small and can seat around 4-5 people along the opposite side of the wall from where they cook. Food served on one side, food eaten on the other. There are a couple tables outside, but it's cold in SF. I've never been to this area before, so luckily I did have some guy friends with me. This part of the Mission is a little creepy at night (to me at least). 

But anywho, this hole-in-the-wall joint is a Mediterranean gem in the Mission. Definitely grab some food here and be prepared to stay satisfied and full for a while.

excerpts: The first time I went, I ordered the "Falafel Deluxe," which is a "Falafel Regular" but with eggplant and potatoes.
I don't really like eggplant
I got the Falafel Regular on my second trip, which I liked better.
Good falafel, nice diced cucumber mix, and tasty tzaziki sauce.
Next time I need to try the garlic mint yoghurt drink.
falafel deluxe.author: Adam B.
falafel deluxe.review:
Solid Mediterranean food. The first time I went, I ordered the "Falafel Deluxe," which is a "Falafel Regular" but with eggplant and potatoes. I don't really like eggplant and I find potatoes in my wrap to be out of place, but I'm a sucker for anything labeled "Deluxe" or "Supreme" or the like (in other words, I'm American).

I got the Falafel Regular on my second trip, which I liked better. Good falafel, nice diced cucumber mix, and tasty tzaziki sauce. Next time I need to try the garlic mint yoghurt drink.

excerpts: Came here last night and ordered a falafel deluxe.
After ordering, I found out what makes it deluxe - they add potatoes and eggplant.
Turns out, that shit is delicious.
To me, the potato in the falafel was kind of like rice in a burrito; it has to be really flavorful on its own or it doesn't add anything but filler to the falafel.
But the eggplant was well-prepared, sweet and tangy and eggplanty.
falafel deluxe.author: Joseph N.
falafel deluxe.review:
Came here last night and ordered a falafel deluxe.  After ordering, I found out what makes it deluxe - they add potatoes and eggplant.  Turns out, that shit is delicious.  To me, the potato in the falafel was kind of like rice in a burrito; it has to be really flavorful on its own or it doesn't add anything but filler to the falafel.  But the eggplant was well-prepared, sweet and tangy and eggplanty.  I'd never had either ingredient in a falafel before, but now that I've seen the light I'm hooked.

I think the falafel could have used more tahini sauce, but this was the best falafel I've had in the city.  I also got a few dolmas, which were pretty good.  Not as good as Myconos, but good nonetheless.

Definitely a good, healthier alternative to burritos if you've had too many of those (and not because you're tired of them, because burritos are way too awesome for that to happen, but sometimes you need to take a break for health reasons).  

I'm eager to try their other stuff, I'm thinking next visit I'll get a shawerma.

excerpts: Decent hole in the wall Falafel Deluxe but the combination of being a little too spicy and lacking strong flavor is never ideal.
9$ is not exactly a steal when compared to comparable burritos in the area but solid for a quick grab if you don't feel like waiting in line.
falafel deluxe.author: Ojus P.
falafel deluxe.review: Decent hole in the wall Falafel Deluxe but the combination of being a little too spicy and lacking strong flavor is never ideal. 9$ is not exactly a steal when compared to comparable burritos in the area but solid for a quick grab if you don't feel like waiting in line.

excerpts: Get the falafel deluxe or the lamb deluxe and you're in for a big balanced treat.

These days I always go for the falafel deluxe which includes 2 smushed up big fresh falafel pieces, few strips of soft grilled eggplant, seasoned diced potatoes, and their special garlic and hot sauce spread
all rolled up in a wrap.
After a few minutes of it being toasted nicely on their grill, it's ready to consume and enjoy.
Havn't came across a shewerma place better than this in the city.
falafel deluxe.author: Patrick L.
falafel deluxe.review: The shawerma's here are delicious. Get the falafel deluxe or the lamb deluxe and you're in for a big balanced treat. These days I always go for the falafel deluxe which includes 2 smushed up big fresh falafel pieces, few strips of soft grilled eggplant, seasoned diced potatoes, and their special garlic and hot sauce spread all rolled up in a wrap. After a few minutes of it being toasted nicely on their grill, it's ready to consume and enjoy. Havn't came across a shewerma place better than this in the city.

excerpts: The chicken shawerma is only served on Tues and Friday though, but dont be afraid of the chicken kabob wrap or the falafel deluxe.
falafel deluxe.author: Jbot S.
falafel deluxe.review:
Every thing Ive ever eaten here has been tasty.

My fave, however is the chicken shawerma. Bring your appetite and love for slightly spicy and amazing Mediterranean food.
The chicken shawerma is only served on Tues and Friday though, but dont be afraid of the chicken kabob wrap or the falafel deluxe. They are both on par with aforementioned chicken shawerma.

Do NOT plan on sitting though. There are almost no seats and very limited space.

excerpts: I always get the Falafel Deluxe with Baba Ganoush instead of fries.
falafel deluxe.author: Natalie G.
falafel deluxe.review:
When I am aching for a giant, hot, wrap stuffed with the good lovin, I come here. I always get the Falafel Deluxe with Baba Ganoush instead of fries. 

Lavash, 'Spicy Paste' (optional..but..I don't understand why you wouldn't get it..), Tahinni Sauce, Baba Ganoush, cucumber, onions, and 5 fat Falafel Balls. This monster wrap is then tossed on the grill. Once you get your greedy paws on it..it's hot..crisped..and....

I can't even continue. I need to go there right now...

excerpts: The lamb schwarma and chicken schwarma are both amazing, but the falafel deluxe sandwich (with eggplant and fries) is where it's at for me!
falafel deluxe.author: Jill M.
falafel deluxe.review:
The lamb schwarma and chicken schwarma are both amazing, but the falafel deluxe sandwich (with eggplant and fries) is where it's at for me! On top of the good eats, the staff is quick, courteous, and the price is right.

What a yummy spot. Truly Med is a must when visiting Dalva or Delirium.

excerpts: Keep making me the best falafel deluxe with extra hot sauce I've ever had (no, I haven't traveled to the middle east and had TRULY authentic Mediterranean food, but who cares?).
Everything I get there is always well spiced, perfectly crisp/cooked, and just yumalicious!
falafel deluxe.author: Miss C.
falafel deluxe.review:
LOVE IT! So good. I think I go there maybe once a week? Maybe more? I even eat in there sometimes... Yes, in that tiny space where you have to watch yourself eat -- there's a mirror placed right above the counter there to either make that  place look bigger or so you can make sure you don't have dried tahini on your face when you leave... Their food is so good, and it's a plus that they got a perfect score on their health/cleanliness code check thing (whatever it's called).

Sometimes the guys working there give me funny looks, but whatever... Keep making me the best falafel deluxe with extra hot sauce I've ever had (no, I haven't traveled to the middle east and had TRULY authentic Mediterranean food, but who cares?). Everything I get there is always well spiced, perfectly crisp/cooked, and just yumalicious! I'll keep coming back for as long as you're there, Truly Mediterranean...

Maybe I'll go back right now! Yum...

excerpts:
Falafel Deluxe.
Exploded after 4 bites.
falafel deluxe.author: Diana Y.
falafel deluxe.review:
Falafel Deluxe.
Exploded after 4 bites.
It was not tasty.  

I am sad.  

So I write haiku about my sadness.

*************************************
UPDATE: 06/28/2007

Went back and got a lamb shawerma and mediterranean combo plate.  They were good, though the meat was a bit tough and chewy.  But.  I change my mind about this place.  I'm gonna toss a couple extra stars their way.

excerpts: Oh yeah, their falafel deluxe is good too, maybe the best outside of Israel, but if it's a Chicken Shawerma day I can't be bothered with anything else!
falafel deluxe.author: Ian G.
falafel deluxe.review:
The best chicken shawerma (spelling varies, but since they make the best, I spell it like they do) in the universe.  For some reason it's only available on Tuesday and Friday.  I used to drive over from the East Bay and bring them back for lunch.  The other days they have lamb shawerma, which I ordered once and never again.  Don't they understand it's the chicken they excel at?  I totally agree with the comment "I have driven with my knees to scarf down this meal."  In fact, I also add a little improvised placemat to catch any drippings that may seep out the bottom of the foil wrapper.  Oh yeah, their falafel deluxe is good too, maybe the best outside of Israel, but if it's a Chicken Shawerma day I can't be bothered with anything else!

UPDATE: I ate here again after a long absence, and they made me a "shawerrito" -- that's a crappy chicken shawerma made by an all-Mexican staff playing salsa music. It was NOT GOOD. Truly Mediterranean is no longer True or Mediterranean.

excerpts: I had the falafel deluxe with hot sauce and it was fantastic.
My only complaint: no seating and no one warned me on Yelp!, come on guys!
It was freezing so we decided to grab and take home rather than sit outside on the two plastic chairs.
I'm going to have to go back to try some of the other items on the menu.
Thanks gang, great place!
falafel deluxe.author: Jeremy S.
falafel deluxe.review: I don't know why I never heard of this place, but everyone has been raving on Yelp! so I dropped by Saturday night. I had the falafel deluxe with hot sauce and it was fantastic. My only complaint: no seating and no one warned me on Yelp!, come on guys! It was freezing so we decided to grab and take home rather than sit outside on the two plastic chairs. I'm going to have to go back to try some of the other items on the menu. Thanks gang, great place!

excerpts:
So, flashing my biggest, braciest smile (as an apology for my lack of knowledge), I quickly asked, "what's the difference between the Falafel and Falafel Deluxe?"

"Falafel Deluxe has potato and eggplant."

"Ooh, I'll have a Falafel Deluxe!"
falafel deluxe.author: Mariah M.
falafel deluxe.review:
The men behind the counter seemed pretty serious, and I didn't want to bother them with any obnoxious questions.  So, flashing my biggest, braciest smile (as an apology for my lack of knowledge), I quickly asked, "what's the difference between the Falafel and Falafel Deluxe?"

"Falafel Deluxe has potato and eggplant."

Yes, they were serious; serious in a ready-to-make-the-food-now kind of way.   There was no time to waver.  I knew that the Falafel itself was going to be enormous, but who was I to deny the siren call of eggplant? And for just a dollar more? The devils!

"Ooh, I'll have a Falafel Deluxe!"

Quickly they worked, slapping together a flatbread sandwich that grew larger and larger by the second.  My stomach grumbled - in desire or protest?  Moments later I was back out on 16th with my prize in tow, and I had only spent $7.65.  That's pretty cheap for something that was larger than my stomach.

Delicious?  I had convinced myself before beginning my eating odyssey that I could only possibly eat half, but as I chowed through the wrap, my brain kept saying, "no, just ONE more bite of the part with the falafel!  No no, now just ONE more bite of the part with the eggplant!  Now, come on, gotta have ONE more taste of that falafel!"

Suddenly it was over. All that was left was the tahini sauce, coating my hands like a trophy.

excerpts: I got the Falafel Deluxe w/out fried potatoes sub hummus.
It was what I wanted, and when I asked for no potatoes what the man behind the counter suggested.
I appreciated his mind reading customer satisfaction skills.
falafel deluxe.author: Miel H.
falafel deluxe.review:
I don't wanna raise my hackles every time one of my friends says "oh, this is the best". I wanna go try their place and come away with my fingers licked to the nibs, stomach satiated and even, on occasion, ebullient.

So.

This place is super small; it has a wall with a slim bar and stools and a minuscule outside eating area. Take out would be a good option, esp.if there was a scenic destination involved. 

I got the Falafel Deluxe w/out fried potatoes sub hummus. It was what I wanted, and when I asked for no potatoes what the man behind the counter suggested. I appreciated his mind reading customer satisfaction skills. Er, ok, I am prolly not the only one, I realize. 

The wrap was huge, I had to save the tail to wag later. For $7 bucks and some change, it was def a meal that didn't leave you hungry. I like how they grill the lavash at the end and the eggplant was soft but not burnt. The hot sauce was medium in my opinion and the hummus was bland. But in a package all together with the falafel, it worked. 

So.

For speed, cost, size/value I will give four stars, but for total flavor satisfaction, I am holding back on that last star.

excerpts: I ordered my falafel deluxe, grabbed a ginger beer and sat down to wait for my wrap.
I won't tell you whether or not I ate my falafel deluxe after that, or whether I licked at the tahini that dripped onto the back of my hand.
falafel deluxe.author: N. L.
falafel deluxe.review:
it was a dark and stormy night. I'd just finished watching a documentary on sandwiches and as soon as it was over, I was aching for a falafel.  The rain and late hour kept me from going out and picking one up, so I spent the rest of the night dreaming of where I could get a crispy falafel in tender lavash the next day.  I knew the joint near my place wouldn't suffice, as I'd seen a cockroach near the water pitcher one time and ever since then, just hadn't had the urge to go. I know, I know, lots of places have cockroaches, but once I saw one I guess my brain just lost all taste for that particular place. 

Having lived in the Mission for 8 years prior to my new neighborhood, I knew Truly Mediterranen would totally hit the spot for my craving.  Their schwermas are great, and the falafel is fried just perfect.  So the next day, I trekked over to Truly Med for lunch.  I ordered my falafel deluxe, grabbed a ginger beer and sat down to wait for my wrap.

Unfortunately, the next few minutes will forever remain burned in my brain and I will very likely NEVER return to this place.  

I sat at the counter casually looking through the mirror at the workers behind me.  Apparently, the tahini sauce ran out, so one of them went to the back to grab the bucket they keep it in.  After pouring the refill, this guy USED HIS BARE FINGER TO WIPE THE RIM, letting the tahini slide off HIS BARE FINGER back into the bucket. 

Sure, he might have washed his hands before doing that, or he could have just been holding his warts-encrusted member in the bathroom. Who's to say? The point is, no respectful cook would ever do that let alone where everyone can see.

I won't tell you whether or not I ate my falafel deluxe after that, or whether I licked at the tahini that dripped onto the back of my hand.  But I will say that unless I'm stumbling drunk on 16th and craving a falafel, I will NEVER GO BACK TO TRULY MEDITERRANEAN.

Next time, do that in the back, bro.

excerpts: The Chicken Shawerma and the Falafel Deluxe is what it's all about!!!
I don't eat Lamb but friends have told me it's to die for!
Not really a place to sit and eat at....very limited seating.
This is a more take out type of place.
This is the one place to not miss out on!
falafel deluxe.author: Matt C.
falafel deluxe.review: If you want one of the best hole in the wall places...this is it!!! I dream about the food...if that tells you anything! Hah! The prices are very reasonable! ($5.00 to $7.00) It doesn't get any better than that! It's cheaper than fast food and a lot healthier!!! The Chicken Shawerma and the Falafel Deluxe is what it's all about!!! I don't eat Lamb but friends have told me it's to die for! Not really a place to sit and eat at....very limited seating. This is a more take out type of place. This is the one place to not miss out on!

excerpts: the falafel deluxe is also good if you're a vegetarian, but i think i'll be sticking to the chicken shewermas from now on.
ORANGINA with your meal ftw (for the win!)
falafel deluxe.author: Janina U.
falafel deluxe.review:
I have classes at the Centro del Pueblo down the street and I love the location due to the only fact its so near Truly Medierranean.  My classmate told me to grab a shewerma there.  best advice ever.

i tried both the chicken shewerma and lamb.  i'm indifferent with the lamb. the chicken is awesome, it's finger licking good.  you can scarf it down in one sitting even if it's so fulfilling by the time you're done with half of it.  my roommate doesn't like cucumbers, so its best if you ask no cucumber salad instead of having to pause and pick it out.  

the falafel deluxe is also good if you're a vegetarian, but i think i'll be sticking to the chicken shewermas from now on.  ORANGINA with your meal ftw (for the win!)

excerpts: All I've had so far is Truly's Falafel Deluxe, and deluxe it is!
This fabulous tasting wonderment is gigantic, stuffed with grilled onion, cucumber, tahini, spicy pepper spread, falafel, eggplant, and french fries.
I mean, is there really a better thing to eat while drunk (or just really hungry)?
There's always the off chance, but this is pretty close to street food perfection.
I order the Deluxe sans potato, substituting for babaganough (smoked eggplant spread) instead, and without the potatoes it's insanely filling.
falafel deluxe.author: Shannon F.
falafel deluxe.review:
All I've had so far is Truly's Falafel Deluxe, and deluxe it is! This fabulous tasting wonderment is gigantic, stuffed with grilled onion, cucumber, tahini, spicy pepper spread, falafel, eggplant, and french fries. I mean, is there really a better thing to eat while drunk (or just really hungry)? There's always the off chance, but this is pretty close to street food perfection. I order the Deluxe sans potato, substituting for babaganough (smoked eggplant spread) instead, and without the potatoes it's insanely filling. They wrap that giant sucker up and put it on their hot grill for a few moments to slightly char the lavash and heat everything up. 

Nice service and brilliant food. If only it wasn't so hard to find parking at this hip corner of the Mission.

excerpts: Falafel Deluxe with hot sauce + extra tahini sauce + roasted tomatoes = heaven.
falafel deluxe.author: Kat P.
falafel deluxe.review:
Falafel Deluxe with hot sauce + extra tahini sauce + roasted tomatoes = heaven.

Seriously, I eat here at least twice a month--if not, I go insane.  For a rolling good time, take your shwarma or falafel and a pack of cards then head into Dalva's next door for a beer drinkin', poker playin' Mediterranean feast.

The food is fast and tasty, the staff is personal and funny, and the size of the joint only enhances its charm.

excerpts: I got the Falafel Deluxe (falafel, eggplant), the SO got the Lamb Shawarma.
Both were served quickly and both were enormous and filling.
The variety of ingredients is good but flavor is lacking.
falafel deluxe.author: Kevin H.
falafel deluxe.review:
Meh. There's better places to get shawarma & falafel.

I got the Falafel Deluxe (falafel, eggplant), the SO got the Lamb Shawarma. Both were served quickly and both were enormous and filling. The variety of ingredients is good but flavor is lacking. Lamb was chewy.

There was a sign that said "Try our mint ginger yogurt drink!" so we did. Meh.

Locals tell me that this place used to be great but it's gone downhill a little. I'd have to agree.

excerpts: Best FALAFEL DELUXE.
Period.
falafel deluxe.author: Dwayne A.
falafel deluxe.review:
Best FALAFEL DELUXE.  Period.  I get one every Friday for lunch.

And people LURVE the shawarmas.  How am I supposed to spell that?  I see it every which way.

Who cares.  EAT ONE!  From Truly Med.

excerpts: Most definitely one of my must-haves when visiting The City is a falafel deluxe!
I have been frequenting this establishment for almost 10 years and the quality of their food has never wavered.
I truly believe that one cannot go wrong with anything on their menu!
falafel deluxe.author: Edel H.
falafel deluxe.review: Most definitely one of my must-haves when visiting The City is a falafel deluxe!  I have been frequenting this establishment for almost 10 years and the quality of their food has never wavered.  I truly believe that one cannot go wrong with anything on their menu!

excerpts: so what if the eggplant in the Falafel Deluxe makes me sick after eating about half the wrap?
Seriously, the potatoes in the Falafel Deluxe just made it so fucking delicious
, I don't even know how to explain it.
The ingredients in the wrap were just so comforting.
Yeah, it got kind of heavy towards the end, but
I don't care
falafel deluxe.author: Anna T.
falafel deluxe.review:
Okay, so what if the eggplant in the Falafel Deluxe makes me sick after eating about half the wrap?  It was good as hell during the first half!  

Seriously, the potatoes in the Falafel Deluxe just made it so fucking delicious, I don't even know how to explain it.  The ingredients in the wrap were just so comforting.  Yeah, it got kind of heavy towards the end, but I don't care, I enjoyed it until I got full. 

Sometimes, I hate myself for not being able to eat a lot.  COME ON ANNA, STEP IT UP!  I ate about 3/4 of the wrap, but I wanted to eat more.  

My friend got their Sirloin patty in a pita pocket.  She said it was really good, so that's what I'm getting next time!  I can't wait to go back there!

excerpts:
One of the few top Falafel places in the city....

grab a falafel deluxe and walk or ride to delores...
falafel deluxe.author: Sharif R.
falafel deluxe.review:
One of the few top Falafel places in the city....

grab a falafel deluxe and walk or ride to delores...

well worth it!!!

excerpts: I came year yesterday and had the Falafel Deluxe, I think it was supposed to have eggplant in it, but either they forgot to put it in, or it was such a small amount I couldn't tell.
There was french fries in it
I think..unless that was the eggplant?
I liked it, it was good.
A little too saucy, but tasted good.
This is only the 2nd Falafel wrap I've ever had it was different
it had cucumbers in it instead of lettuce, was a bit heavier, but over all delish.
Quick Tip: If this is going to be your first time there, be aware that the place is small.
Only a long table against the wall with bar stools, and outside there are 2 wobbly tables and plastic grimey chairs.
We came here with our baby in a stroller and had to eat outside, and it was windy and cold.
So plan accordingly.

This is only the 2nd Falafel wrap I've ever had it was different it had cucumbers in it instead of lettuce, was a bit heavier, but over all delish. Quick Tip: If this is going to be your first time there, be aware that the place is small.  Only a long table against the wall with bar stools, and outside there are 2 wobbly tables and plastic grimey chairs. excerpts: Falafel Deluxe add feta and hot sauce
falafel deluxe.author: J W.
falafel deluxe.review: Falafel Deluxe add feta and hot sauce

excerpts: Get the Falafel Deluxe with hot sauce.
This isn't a hang-out, this is a place to grab and go.
As for quality, it is a cheap place and the falafel is pretty good and a good value.
falafel deluxe.author: Art K.
falafel deluxe.review:
I really like this place for cheap eats. Get the Falafel Deluxe with hot sauce. This isn't a hang-out, this is a place to grab and go. As for quality, it is a cheap place and the falafel is pretty good and a good value. It is not fantastic, but then I've never had fantastic falafel for that price anywhere. 

I actually don't know of great middle eastern in The City, but in Detroit the place to go is La Shish. The hummus there rings with clarity, and you can get it with toasted pine nuts.

excerpts: This review is for the falafel deluxe, which is all I've ever had aside from some lamb thing one time that I didn't love.
It's a nice combo of falafel, cucumber, eggplant, onions, and fried potatoes, with some hearty sauces in between.
A solid, reliable lunch for those days when you're trying not to eat meat for once.
And the guys who work there can be pretty friendly.
falafel deluxe.author: Marco L.
falafel deluxe.review: This review is for the falafel deluxe, which is all I've ever had aside from some lamb thing one time that I didn't love. It's a nice combo of falafel, cucumber, eggplant, onions, and fried potatoes, with some hearty sauces in between. A solid, reliable lunch for those days when you're trying not to eat meat for once. And the guys who work there can be pretty friendly.

excerpts: One time Sammy (who had the most spotless station in Aroma Cafe in downtown Oakland) made me a falafel deluxe and charged me for a regular falafel.
This event changed my life.
Not because the falafel was crispy where it should have been and tender in all the right places, because it was, and then some.
Yes: there was the unexpected delight of potatoes merging with hot sauce.

But ultimately my fate was sealed when I put the falafel in my pocket when I was on BART and nibbled at it as the tahini slowly seeped into my hoodie's pocket, forever staining it with the rich scents and smells of that deliciously perfect falafel.
falafel deluxe.author: Ross G.
falafel deluxe.review:
One time Sammy (who had the most spotless station in Aroma Cafe in downtown Oakland) made me a falafel deluxe and charged me for a regular falafel. This event changed my life. Not because the falafel was crispy where it should have been and tender in all the right places, because it was, and then some. Yes: there was the unexpected delight of potatoes merging with hot sauce. But ultimately my fate was sealed when I put the falafel in my pocket when I was on BART and nibbled at it as the tahini slowly seeped into my hoodie's pocket, forever staining it with the rich scents and smells of that deliciously perfect falafel. My friends made me throw that hoodie away.

Note: this is one of those places where you eat at a counter facing a mirror. Try this after a night of drinking and see how large the pores in your nose are and how green your face is...then find someone to love you.

excerpts: The falafel deluxe is awesome.
The salad, tahini, onions, eggplant and potatoes provide multiple layers of flavor to compliment the delicious falafel.
I can't think of a better falafel sandwich.
falafel deluxe.author: Siao W.
falafel deluxe.review:
How do they make chick peas taste so good? At truly mediterranean, you can watch them make these delicious balls called falafels. The falafel deluxe is awesome. The salad, tahini, onions, eggplant and potatoes provide multiple layers of flavor to compliment the delicious falafel. I can't think of a better falafel sandwich.
     The lamb shawerma is also great. The lamb/beef combo is bold, well-seasoned, and moist. The tomato, onion, and tahini really bring out the flavor of the meat.
     For a "truly mediterranean" dining experience, you can't go wrong with the combo plate. Love the hummus and baba. The feta cheese and cucumber salad were very fresh. I'm not a huge fan of taboleh or dolmas but they seam to be on par with the other items on the plate.
     Overall, this place rocks. The only negative is the price. 9 dollars for a wrap is a bit much to spend. You do get a lot of bang, but you will have to spend a lot of bucks.

excerpts:
I hear the other stuff is good, but I go for the falafel

falafel deluxe with feta please...to go.
falafel deluxe.author: Ken p.
falafel deluxe.review:
You want falafel? best ever

I hear the other stuff is good, but I go for the falafel

falafel deluxe with feta please...to go.

excerpts: I recommend the falafel deluxe wrap!
falafel deluxe.author: Philip R.
falafel deluxe.review: I eat here about once a week! The restaurant is pretty small and it often gets crowded. They are quick with getting your order to you. Lots of vegan and vegetarian options. I recommend the falafel deluxe wrap!

excerpts: All I get here is the falafel deluxe.
It's the best I've had in this city, or anywhere, so far.
It's not the cheapest falafel, and it's not the closest to me, but it's worth the money and the walk.
falafel deluxe.author: Nik G.
falafel deluxe.review: All I get here is the falafel deluxe. It's the best I've had in this city, or anywhere, so far. It's not the cheapest falafel, and it's not the closest to me, but it's worth the money and the walk.

excerpts: I recommend the falafel deluxe wrap, with the hot sauce.
So good!
falafel deluxe.author: Marvella W.
falafel deluxe.review: Best falafel wrap I've ever had! I wanna go back and get another one! I recommend the falafel deluxe wrap, with the hot sauce.  So good!

Sharif R. has hit the nail on the head, a perfect Saturday, or any nice day in the city:

excerpts: falafel deluxe.
yum, my kind of sandwich.
it's the little things that count.
like freshly fried falafel with nice cucumber/eggplant/potato, excellent red base sauce and white sauce and the grilled wrap, the perfect touch at the end.
will be back for the shawerma (chicken on Tue/Fri)

excerpts: You are just a dry, crumbling excuse for lavash, and not worthy of holding the delicious falafel, eggplant, onion and potato found in the falafel deluxe.
I try to avoid eating things that are not deluxe.
falafel deluxe.author: Steven C.
falafel deluxe.review: Yeah, you move to Texas and try and find a decent falafel. I triple dog dare you. Truly Mediterranean completely ruined my ability to enjoy falafel at most other places. Screw you, pita bread. You are just a dry, crumbling excuse for lavash, and not worthy of holding the delicious falafel, eggplant, onion and potato found in the falafel deluxe. I try to avoid eating things that are not deluxe.

excerpts: seriously...the falafel deluxe (regular falafel wrap with grilled eggplant AND potatoes) is the best permutation of falafel ive ever had.
falafel deluxe.author: sarah i.
falafel deluxe.review:
seriously...the falafel deluxe (regular falafel wrap with grilled eggplant AND potatoes) is the best permutation of falafel ive ever had. 

however...the service here is kinda brusque though, and the FD comes out to almost $8. eh. that ingenuity of putting potatoes in falafel TOTALLY excuses it. TOTALLY.

excerpts: when i'm back in the bay, it's off to the mission for either a kafta kabob, lamb schwarma, or falafel deluxe.
falafel deluxe.author: Charles K.
falafel deluxe.review:
no doubt the best falafels and schwarmas EVER. i've been to many places, SF, LA, NY, st. louis (yeah, don't ask), but nothing compares to those large, crispy, crunchy balls (dude, that sounds nasty). 

they used to have a location on haight and that's where i used to go, but it closed down a few years ago so when i'm back in the bay, it's off to the mission for either a kafta kabob, lamb schwarma, or falafel deluxe. the freshest ingredients, the tastiest hummus and sauces, and the right amount of hot sauce.

go there, get a quick, cheap meal and eat it while you check out the mission area.

excerpts: Since getting a Maoz falafel would cost me hundreds of dollars and some vacation time, I'll gladly take Truly Med's falafel deluxe with its holy trinity of falafel, fried eggplant, and french fries.

I love watching the guys skillfully assemble everything at lightning speed--from spreading the harissa and smooshing the falafels to the final drizzling of tahini and wrapping everything up, each person has his own flourishes.
Then, the whole shebang gets some time on the grill
so it comes to you hot, with the edges of the lavosh a little crisp.
I love the Middle Eastern dance music they play, too.
Just make sure you stick to this location because the others are not as good.
falafel deluxe.author: maiko h.
falafel deluxe.review: The only place that has falafel I like better than Truly Med is Maoz in Holland.  Since getting a Maoz falafel would cost me hundreds of dollars and some vacation time, I'll gladly take Truly Med's falafel deluxe with its holy trinity of falafel, fried eggplant, and french fries.  I love watching the guys skillfully assemble everything at lightning speed--from spreading the harissa and smooshing the falafels to the final drizzling of tahini and wrapping everything up, each person has his own flourishes.  Then, the whole shebang gets some time on the grill so it comes to you hot, with the edges of the lavosh a little crisp.  I love the Middle Eastern dance music they play, too.  Just make sure you stick to this location because the others are not as good.

excerpts: i dunno, i had the falafel deluxe last night and was not blown away.
the "potatoes" looked more like french fries to me (who puts french fries in a falafel???).
and although the top half was piping hot, it got progressively colder the further down
i went.
oasis grill in the financial district (extra hot sauce, please!)

extra star for using lavash instead of pita...

falafel deluxe.review: One of those cheap, but awesome hole-in-the-wall places.  I had a tasty Shawerma... Jeremy had a falafel deluxe that looked pretty good, too.

excerpts: The falafel deluxe has FRENCH FRIES!
and eggplant.
Must try soon...
falafel deluxe.author: Alyssa C.
falafel deluxe.review: I just tried this place. I got falafel with no onions and no hot sauce, added in some hummus. So deeelish! After an hour I almost wanted to go back and get another. The falafel deluxe has FRENCH FRIES! and eggplant. Must try soon...

excerpts: Falafel Deluxe: best...
falafel...ever...
falafel deluxe.author: Maximillian M.
falafel deluxe.review: Falafel Deluxe: best...falafel...ever... The chicken shawerma doesn't exactly live up to the hype, but it IS pretty damn tasty.

excerpts: I've gotten the falafel deluxe every time I've been there, and it is delicious.
Every component is perfect.
I also love the inclusion of eggplant and potatoes in the wrap, and they give you as much or as little sauce as you want so that the kick you get from it is to your taste.
It's a hole-in-the-wall, but it provides yummy, cheap eats.
falafel deluxe.author: Jenny O.
falafel deluxe.review: I've gotten the falafel deluxe every time I've been there, and it is delicious. Every component is perfect. I also love the inclusion of eggplant and potatoes in the wrap, and they give you as much or as little sauce as you want so that the kick you get from it is to your taste. It's a hole-in-the-wall, but it provides yummy, cheap eats.

excerpts: also delicious is the falafel deluxe.
falafel deluxe.author: Noah C.
falafel deluxe.review:
another great place not everyone knows about ... so far.

the chicken shawerma is out of this world !  as mentioned below, it's good to ask for items spicy ... it's surprisingly not too spicy but it does gives each dish a nice depth.

also delicious is the falafel deluxe.  

at lunchtime, there are usually a few people in line ... don't let that discourage you from going ... the staff is very attentive and will keep things moving quickly.

LOVE truly med!

excerpts: I always have the Falafel Deluxe and my husband the Lamb Shawerma
and it just tasty and delicious.
There are only maybe 6 seats inside the place but we still enjoy eating it there while still fresh from the grill.
But with the foil wrap, they stay warm and toasty still when we take it to Ocean Beach, Marina or the Golden Gate Park.
This place has never failed.
falafel deluxe.author: Mavis G.
falafel deluxe.review: I have been going to this place since my college years in the '90s.  They are really as good as it gets for falafel.  I always have the Falafel Deluxe and my husband the Lamb Shawerma and it just tasty and delicious.  There are only maybe 6 seats inside the place but we still enjoy eating it there while still fresh from the grill. i love the hot sauce, eggplant and potato, but if you're in the mood for  meat, the options are there.
falafel deluxe.author: Ligaya T.
falafel deluxe.review: my first time at TM they were blasting 'Aicha.' i freakin love that song, so emotional. anyhow...as a warning never, ever try to split a falafel or shwarma here. the manager refused to half our order on the basis that it was friday and we should eat more! in my multitudes of visits i have not yet finished a falafel deluxe, my scrumptious moiety is the perfect size for me. i love the hot sauce, eggplant and potato, but if you're in the mood for  meat, the options are there.

it's a tiny place with a lot to offer.
too bad they hardly have any place to sit around.
the eggplants are a bit greasy, but all in all...
it's quite yummy

excerpts: I dropped by before a movie at the Roxie and ordered a Lamb Shwerma and my girlfriend order a Falafel Deluxe wrap.
The guy behind the counter asked her how hot she wanted it
and she told him.
I then ordered mine and told the guy medium hot and no onions.
When we got our food, we sat outside and after 1 bite
I realized that mine had onions.
I went inside and nicely  told them that I had asked for no onions.
Instead of apologizing and offering to make it correct, they argued with me repeatedly and refused to offer a replacement.
I threw mine in the garbage (the lamb sucked anyways...)
My girlfriend ate hers and even though she is fine with onions, by the end of the movie, she was pretty ill from the overwhelming portion of onions.
These guys are super rude and the food is "low-grade gog food".
If you want a good gyro, falafel or shwerma, try Balladie on Kearny near downtown.
Ali Baba's cave in lower Haight is also a big thumbs up!
Oh yeah, the food here is about $1 over priced compared to other places.

I dropped by before a movie at the Roxie and ordered a Lamb Shwerma and my girlfriend order a Falafel Deluxe wrap. The guy behind the counter asked her how hot she wanted it and she told him. I then ordered mine and told the guy medium hot and no onions. When we got our food, we sat outside and after 1 bite I realized that mine had onions. I went inside and nicely  told them that I had asked for no onions. Instead of apologizing and offering to make it correct, they argued with me repeatedly and refused to offer a replacement. I threw mine in the garbage (the lamb sucked anyways...) My girlfriend ate hers and even though she is fine with onions, by the end of the movie, she was pretty ill from the overwhelming portion of onions.
These guys are super rude and the food is "low-grade gog food". If you want a good gyro, falafel or shwerma, try Balladie on Kearny near downtown. Ali Baba's cave in lower Haight is also a big thumbs up! Oh yeah, the food here is about $1 over priced compared to other places.

excerpts: The falafel deluxe with hummus instead of potatoes is my favorite.
It's fast, cheap, and delicious.
falafel deluxe.author: Haylee W.
falafel deluxe.review: I go here every time I'm in the city.  The falafel deluxe with hummus instead of potatoes is my favorite.  It's fast, cheap, and delicious.

excerpts: My only complaint is my falafel deluxe is sometimes not quite hot enough.
Otherwise, the best falafel sandwich I have had in the city.
falafel deluxe.author: Neil D.
falafel deluxe.review: My only complaint is my falafel deluxe is sometimes not quite hot enough. Otherwise, the best falafel sandwich I have had in the city.

excerpts: I also tried the lamb shawerma ($9.99) with added eggplant.
The shawerma was huge!!
And very delicious!
Portions here are a very good size.
The owners let us try the falafel on the house and it was delicious as well.
It was coated with tahini sauce and a bit of hot sauce.
lamb shawerma.author: Jean S.
lamb shawerma.review:
Omg! Yum!! Truly Mediterranean is delicious! I tried the lamb combo plate ($12.99) and everything was delicious! The lamb was very tender and juicy, the grilled onions and bell peppers were great, but I especially liked the hummus and tabouleh. This was my first time trying tabouleh and found it very delicious and refreshing, especially with the lime flavor in it. The combo plate also comes with tahini and hot sauce. It was all so good!

I also tried the lamb shawerma ($9.99) with added eggplant. The shawerma was huge!! And very delicious! Portions here are a very good size. The owners let us try the falafel on the house and it was delicious as well. It was coated with tahini sauce and a bit of hot sauce. It was really good!

Truly Mediterranean is one of the best hole-in-the-wall restaurants I've tried. And one of the best Mediterranean restaurants I've tried. This place is pretty small and does not offer much seating, but it also was not crowded. Ordering to-go might be the best option. They also use Door Dash incase you want delivery. I would definitely recommend this place for some good Mediterranean food. And make sure to come hungry as portions are large.

excerpts: I love their lamb shawerma where the meat is so tender as you can see when they slice it off the rotating stick and taste it in your gyro with a crisp pita wrap.
More importantly, the service is friendly, helpful, and fast.
Thus, I'd come back in a heart beat for any of the tasty Mediterranean options!
lamb shawerma.author: Jenny L.
lamb shawerma.review: If you're ever in need of a quick bite near the Roxie Theater, this is one of the best options.  I love their lamb shawerma where the meat is so tender as you can see when they slice it off the rotating stick and taste it in your gyro with a crisp pita wrap.  More importantly, the service is friendly, helpful, and fast.  Thus, I'd come back in a heart beat for any of the tasty Mediterranean options!

excerpts: So sad cause I really want that lamb shawerma.
lamb shawerma.author: Inez J.
lamb shawerma.review:
Chicken only on tuesdays and fridays! I wish I did my research before coming here. So sad cause I really want that lamb shawerma.

No restrooms. How can a restaurant not have restrooms?! How can you let customers eat without washing their hands?!

The only seating is inside (bar-like) and outside (next to a bus stop and flying pigeons).

But that falafel is bomb.

The lamb shawerma is ON point. I've had a lot of lamb shawerma and this is amazing. If I wasn't on a diet, I'd come here much more regularly.
