lamb shawerma.review:
7x7 100 Best Things To Eat In SF Before You Die 2013

#97 Lamb Shawerma from Truly Mediterranean

It was pretty serendipitous that I ended up at Truly Mediterranean. The bar Dalva is literally a few buildings down so when my friend wanted to get food we stumbled right into Truly Mediterranean. 

I was super eager to try their Lamb Shawerma after smelling the amazing aroma in the air plus seeing all that glistening meat ready to be devoured! 

First plus, the wrap was served piping hot. Most places serve it lukewarm at best so this definitely set them apart right off the bat. Secondly, the lamb was a true stand out. It was tender, had a great earthy flavor that was balanced well with the uses of various herbs and spices. Lastly, the portions were quite generous and filling. 

The spicy sauce is quite good but it can be a little overwhelming so if you really want to taste the dish I would opt out of adding the hot sauce.

Overall Thoughts

Great Lamb Shawerma that is well worth coming back for time and time again

The lamb shawerma was wrapped in a large lavash bread, filled with meaty, well seasoned lamb (NOT gamey at all), parsley, onions,tomatoes and tahini sauce.
It was so good and filling it
had me saying "my habibi!
lamb shawerma.author: Janice C.
lamb shawerma.review:
I like terms of endearment. 

"Sweetie" is one of 'em.  Somehow, that coming from an older gentleman with a kind smile and welcoming vibe doesn't come across as pervy.

That set the mood for me at Truly Mediterranean. Definitely hole in a wall: few counter stools to the side; near the entrance, the shawerma slowly turning on its end, getting roasted by fire; map of the Mediterranean on one wall and menu on the opposite one.

Take note that if you come here on a Tuesday or Friday, you'll be disappointed to find that the lamb shawerma isn't on the rotation (but the chicken is) But you really come here because of the LAMB SHAWERMA, so plan accordingly.

The lamb shawerma was wrapped in a large lavash bread, filled with meaty, well seasoned lamb (NOT gamey at all), parsley, onions,tomatoes and tahini sauce. It was so good and filling it had me saying "my habibi!" (aka:baby) with every delicious bite. 

My only beef? $8 for this thing. A tad pricey, but that's why your honey pays for lunch.

excerpts: After hearing all the accolades about the lamb shawerma here, I decided to saunter on in late Friday night.

lamb shawerma.review:
After hearing all the accolades about the lamb shawerma here, I decided to saunter on in late Friday night. To my disappointment, I discovered that only chicken shawerma is served on Fridays. Thats ok I thought, chicken is harder to muck up versus lamb right? I mean chicken is one of the easier meats to cook.. can't be too hard to make it juicy unless it was cooked hours ago and was just sitting around in a cold metal bin.. Too bad the chicken was in fact sitting in one of those metal bins. 

My shawerma was incredibly dry, room temperature, and bland.. the only thing saving it from my cutting the innards of mouth open were the tomatoes and barely there shawerma sauce. The guys working the counter also didn't want to be there - customer service wasn't obviously on their minds. For $10 and crappy service, I expect to have a decent takeaway meal, especially with so many options nearby in the Mission. How is this place still around?

excerpts: Stopped here today for a lamb shawerma, not expecting too much.
Boy, was I pleasantly surprised!
Everyone here is so nice and helpful.
I can't  do raw tomatoes, so I asked for them left off...
the counter man very nicely offered my choice of something else to replace them!
I took the hummus.
GOOD CHOICE!
I also saw one of the guys pulling out freshly made falafel.
They looked SO
GOOD
I wished I'd ordered a few to take away.
Next time for sure....
Mmmm a 'doggy bag' of falafel to munch throughout the afternoon!
I'm drooling.
C'mon let's face it... when you order lamb shawerma, you wanna taste the LAMB.
lamb shawerma.author: Scott T.
lamb shawerma.review:
Stopped here today for a lamb shawerma, not expecting too much.  Boy, was I pleasantly surprised!  Everyone here is so nice and helpful.  I can't  do raw tomatoes, so I asked for them left off... the counter man very nicely offered my choice of something else to replace them!  So.... I took the hummus.  GOOD CHOICE!  I also saw one of the guys pulling out freshly made falafel.  They looked SO GOOD I wished I'd ordered a few to take away.  Next time for sure.... Mmmm a 'doggy bag' of falafel to munch throughout the afternoon!  I'm drooling.  And that hummus... definitely will need to see if I can get a take out container to bring home next time!!

It's more a Levant restaurant, so don't go there thinking it's Greek.  And yes, the shawerma are on toasted lavash.  I thought the lavash was relatively light and flaky, unlike at some other Med restaurants I've tried in the city.  

The owners could make a slam dunk if they also owned a little Med/Mid-East grocery right next door :-)  Speaking of... I definitely need a good rec for a Greek/Mid-East grocer.  Why is it so hard to find decent dolmas, fresh baklava, and all those luscious spices in SF?

This place is great for a quick bite, whether a midday pick-me-up or a drunken night out snack.  If you find yourself in the Mission and jonesing for some good Middle-Eastern food, stop in.  You'll be glad you did.

Prices were very reasonable, and I was pleasantly surprised that the posted prices INCLUDED the sales tax!  And the portion is spot on.  Actually, I was pleasantly surprised that there was so much lamb inside!  C'mon let's face it... when you order lamb shawerma, you wanna taste the LAMB.  And this place delivers, in spades.  

Truly Med, you have a new fan, and I can't wait to go back!  Fortunately, it's right near the 16th/Mission BART station, so it's convenient to get to, coming from the East Bay (or even walking up from work in downtown SF, then catch the BART home from there).

Now I can't wait to go back to have the falafel... and more of that AMAZING hummus!  Not too garlicky, and with bright citrus notes.  It was great on the shawerma, and it'll be great on falafel, salad, pita, fingers.... whatever is handy!  I'm usually a dyed-in-the-wool tzatziki fan (and always will be), but the tahini and hummus together were delicious.

lamb shawerma.author: Timothy C.
lamb shawerma.review:
#97 on the 7x7 Big Eat - Lamb Shawerma at Truly Mediterranean.  I went here on Monday night after an Allegash draft at Monk's Kettle down the street (subsequently knocking off # 50 - Obscure Belgian Beer at Monk's Kettle.)  Truly Med is an unassuming hole in the wall gyro and shawerma spot serving up some seriously good Mediterranean fare.  

While I was eager to try their falafel, I wanted to stick to the list and got with the lamb shawerma.  They serve this bad boy up with thin lamb slices cut right off the spit, soft broiled tomatoes, parsley, onions, and tahini all wrapped up in a Lavash.  I opted out of the onions (bleck!) and added hummus instead (I love hummus!!)  After they wrap everything up in the lavash, they put it on the grill and fire it up for you, leaving these perfect grill marks on the wrap.  

This was really good wrap.  I usually enjoy shawermas and gyros, and this place was no exception. Every bite was packed with flavor; I was in heaven.  The meat was tender and juicy.  Every bite I took oozed out hummus from the bottom.  The hot lavash played will with the cold tahini.  Fantastic!  And thing is huge!  I was so stuffed.  Next time I'm definitely going to try their falafel, and I also noticed they serve up chicken shawermas on Tuesday and Friday.  I'm hitting this place up for sure next time I'm in the mission... which will probably be like tomorrow!

There is also a small table outside that seats 2 so on a beautiful day, it would be nice to eat outside (those are rare in SF).

Fantastic place here found on 16th and Valencia.  I've seen the recommendation for the chicken shawerma but the first time I went, it wasn't a tuesday nor a friday so I ended up going with the lamb shawerma.  It was delicious, especially with the spicy sauce and the yogurt sauce with cucumbers and onions.

I did end up trying the chicken shawerma on a future visit as well as the lamb kabob and I found that the lamb wraps were more enjoyable.  I know much of the population doesn't like the gamey lamb taste but if you do like lamb, you should try out the lamb kabob and shawerma here.  Great mediterranean food. Highly recommend.

excerpts: Lamb Shawerma - so much could go wrong, but they do it
So Right.
lamb shawerma.author: Tiff W.
lamb shawerma.review:
Truly Mediterranean is a fantastic establishment - a gem, located in the heart of the Mission, and well worth any trip across town.

Their falafels are extraordinary, so far surpassing ordinary, that I find myself tongue-twisted, when I try to describe what objects of beauty they are. Crisp, chestnuty-burnt-russet-sienna outer spheres encompassing light, earthy-green treasures (sesame seeds, chickpeas, parsley, etc.) of "oh...wow," these perfect-sized nuggets are packed with natural, honest flavor. I love the way they smell and the way they sound a crunch, when I give them a gentle squeeze. A drizzle or dunk in tahini is an absolute must!

Lamb Shawerma - so much could go wrong, but they do it So Right. Spiced, moist, tangy, balanced: it's composed of tender, slow-roasted lamb and beef, broiled tomatoes, seasoned onions, fresh parsley, tahini, and spicy sauce all bundled up and hugged by grilled lavash.

Mediterranean Combo Plate - an assortment of goodies... falafels, dolmas, baba ghannouj, tabouleh, hummus, cucumber salad, feta, seasoned onions, tahini, spicy sauce, and grilled pita. Great to share with a friend!

Kind, personable, unassuming staff.
Fresh, consistent, authentic cuisine.
Reasonable prices (at 15cents/dolma, 40cents/falafel, etc..)

Thank goodness for the law of diminishing marginal utility, because if it weren't for her, I'd go much more often.

Truly Med, you have yet to fail me.

excerpts:
Oh, how I've missed you my extra saucy lamb shawerma, DE-to the-LUX!!!

The smell of your half, still resides in my room, as I type this love story... between me and the extra saucy lamb shawerma!
lamb shawerma.author: SammyWammy S.
lamb shawerma.review:
Last night, I had the pleasure of reuniting with my love, at last we have made peace!

-------

This is my Love story!

Oh, how I've missed you my extra saucy lamb shawerma, DE-to the-LUX!!!

You truly are a blessing in my life, especially when made to my hearts desire!!!

Just one bite is all it took...

As I found myself holding on to you, with both of my hands.  Just trying to keep you in tact. There was only one place you were headed. You had a one way ticket, going on one way street. Directed towards my salivating mouth. Have my teeth showed up for work tonight?! Affirmative! Ready to chop chop chop at my command.  As my heart falls in deep to the ever so loveliness of bursting flavors! Overwhelmed with comfort, I can rest assure, that there is MORE of you to come. So, I had only half of you last night and what a pleasure t'was! I fell asleep with a content heart as the earth continued to turn.  Before waking I dreamed of you, heating you up, to that crisp perfection! (crunch crunch crunch, I heard) So, naturally I awakened in search of you my dear other half, craving your very juicy cylinder shaped self! 3 minutes pass and then... Oh dear! I've eaten the last bite!  One tear has dropped and rolled down my right cheek, in remembrance of you, my dearest.  Why didn't I eat your cylinder shaped self slower? Why'd I have to devour you so quickly? How will I move on? The smell of your half, still resides in my room, as I type this love story... between me and the extra saucy lamb shawerma!

A true love affair never dies, I crave you "Heveryday"  

pssst...yes the "H" is supposed to be there...it represents passion ;)

excerpts: If I'm in the area again, I will probably come by and try one of the wraps,  possibly the lamb shawerma, since so many other reviewers rave about it.
lamb shawerma.author: Shamina K.
lamb shawerma.review:
This place is tiny as hell, with only like 6 bar stools.  I guess you don't really need a lot of room since it's mainly a wraps place and people are in and out.  I came here with my cousin, and we both thought the food was really good.  

We weren't really in the mood for a wrap, so we ordered the wraps 'unwrapped'.  We ordered the chicken kabob which was flavorfu and came with a side of tomatoes and cucumbers with this tasty yogurt sauce and also some wheat naan. We had also ordered the falafel, which was crispy and yummy and also some hummus, which was really good!  If I'm in the area again, I will probably come by and try one of the wraps,  possibly the lamb shawerma, since so many other reviewers rave about it.

excerpts: Now I stop by every few weeks, and while I miss my favorite spots in Zurich and Berlin, Truly Med does a fantastic kefta kebab, lamb shawerma, and good ol' falafel for when you want those cute clothes to fit right.
lamb shawerma.author: Joanna M.
lamb shawerma.review:
In college I studied abroad in Switzerland and more or less had a great experience.

While there I became intimately acquainted with the following, in chronological order:

1.) Fondue
2.) My expanding ass after eating said fondue
3.) Poverty after spending a lot of my money on fondue and new clothes from awesome Zurich boutiques to accommodate that ass.

After all this, I ditched the cheese and began eating falafel, shawerma, and kebabs because I could afford it, there were FIVE shawerma places to choose from on my block, and, most importantly, I get giddy at the sight of meat spinning in windows.  And thus we became intimately acquainted. (Hi Ömer!)  Upon return to the states, I swore off fondue (still can't do it) but I bemoaned the lack of shawerma in SF until a date introduced me to Truly Med.  

Now I stop by every few weeks, and while I miss my favorite spots in Zurich and Berlin, Truly Med does a fantastic kefta kebab, lamb shawerma, and good ol' falafel for when you want those cute clothes to fit right.  And if you're on a date or plan to go on one within a month, avoid the garlic mint yogurt drink. It's deadly.

excerpts: By the way, BE SURE to order a lamb shawerma SPICY.
It's the only thing that will let me sleep comfortably at night.
lamb shawerma.author: CHRISTIAN P.
lamb shawerma.review:
This is my absolute favourite place to get a shawerma. Every bite is like HEAVEN on a bun served by Swedish prostitute with a perfect figure. Yes, it's THAT GOOD. The place is a hole in the wall, just off of 16th st. DON'T YOU DARE pass it up though, or you'll deprive yourself of a truly Mediterranean piece of art wrapped up in aluminum foil.....

 By the way, BE SURE to order a lamb shawerma SPICY. It's the only thing that will let me sleep comfortably at night.

excerpts: My partner got the famous lamb shawerma sandwich with the tomatoes that have been cooked in the lamb drippings and he ate it
but he seemed disappointed.
I think he wasn't crazy about the sauce that was on it
but that might just be him.
Bottom line:  fabulous.
lamb shawerma.author: Joseph C.
lamb shawerma.review: Truly Mediterranean has the best falafel that I've ever had.  Their sandwiches are fucking amazing and may just be definitive proof that there's a god after all.  I got the falafel deluxe which had the addition of potatoes and eggplant.  What I liked about the sandwich was that every element had a distinctive flavor and all of the elements complemented one another very well.  Eating it is that complex barrage of flavors and it's just delicious.  My partner got the famous lamb shawerma sandwich with the tomatoes that have been cooked in the lamb drippings and he ate it but he seemed disappointed.  I think he wasn't crazy about the sauce that was on it but that might just be him.  Bottom line:  fabulous.

excerpts: Lamb Shawerma!!!!!!!!
The 2013 7x7 Big Eat list brought me here.
100 things to eat in SF before you die so you better get over there and order that.
Big portion and don't forget a side of chili sauce.
It's really not spicy at all...
but who doesn't like extra sauce with their meal?
GET IT
GET
IT
GET IT!!!!!
lamb shawerma.author: Nancy N.
lamb shawerma.review: Lamb Shawerma!!!!!!!! The 2013 7x7 Big Eat list brought me here. 100 things to eat in SF before you die so you better get over there and order that. Big portion and don't forget a side of chili sauce. It's really not spicy at all... but who doesn't like extra sauce with their meal? GET IT GET IT GET IT!!!!!

excerpts: It's not the cheapest thing - $10 for the lamb shawerma.
I want to try the other menu items, but the lamb shawerma was sooo good, I don't know if I want to venture.
Plus it's right next to the 16th st bart
lamb shawerma.author: Aditi R.
lamb shawerma.review:
The. Best. Lamb. Shawerma. I've. Ever. Had.

A tiny hole in the wall that packs in so much flavor and punch. I absolutely LOVE mediterranean food and I've had them at the most renowned places in NYC, Boston, and many other cities. But this one left all of them behind.

Reasons: The meat itself. So juicy, not dry at all and tons of it! They don't skimp and I love that. Second, they toast the wrap. I've never seen that done before. After they put all the fillings in, they put it on the grill so that when you bite in, they're hot and slightly crispy and that adds SO much to the presentation and flavor! No sogginess to deal with and everything is packed in so well. Lastly, the rest of the fillings itself - the yogurt, the spicy spread, tomatoes..everything! 

It's not the cheapest thing - $10 for the lamb shawerma. And almost all of the items on the menu are around that price, but the place takes credit cards (even Amex!) if you spend more than $6, which you easily will. 

I want to try the other menu items, but the lamb shawerma was sooo good, I don't know if I want to venture. Plus it's right next to the 16th st bart stop making it easily accessible.

Lastly, the service is awesome. They're really nice people and greet every single person that comes in and leaves. There wasn't a thing I didn't like. Love this place.

excerpts: I tried lamb shawerma and it was awsome, tasted healthy and fresh, he asked me if i want hot sauce before adding it
and i said yes
but next time i will have it without hot sauce because the lamb was tasty enough without that much pepper

, the shawerma was baked on the oven before serving and i liked the baked taste of the bread, there was not so much space to eat inside and there was couple of tables outside; but i will definitely come back for the quality of the food and reasonable price!
Good job!
lamb shawerma.author: Mina N.
lamb shawerma.review: I tried lamb shawerma and it was awsome, tasted healthy and fresh, he asked me if i want hot sauce before adding it and i said yes but next time i will have it without hot sauce because the lamb was tasty enough without that much pepper, the shawerma was baked on the oven before serving and i liked the baked taste of the bread, there was not so much space to eat inside and there was couple of tables outside; but i will definitely come back for the quality of the food and reasonable price! Good job!

excerpts: Their lamb shawerma is also very good.
It comes with a large amount of juicy, tender meat, creamy hummus and spicy sauce.
Just wonderful!
lamb shawerma.author: Elaine L.
lamb shawerma.review:
The falafels here are AMAZING! They are super crisp on the outside and you can literally hear the crunch if you press down on it. The inside is light and flavorful - delish!

I got their mediterranean combo plate which comes with delicious hummus and baba ghannouj. So good with pita and falafels and cucumber salad and tabouleh.

Their lamb shawerma is also very good. It comes with a large amount of juicy, tender meat, creamy hummus and spicy sauce. Just wonderful!

excerpts: What caught my eye was the chicken and lamb shawerma in the pictures that looked more like a burrito.
lamb shawerma.author: Dennis L.
lamb shawerma.review:
Last time I was craving some Mediterranean food, I stopped by Daphne's. big mistake. Since then, I vowed not to eat the crap that they serve, in search of something more authentic and with fewer than a million locations. 

Thanks to yelp, I discovered Truly Mediterranean. What caught my eye was the chicken and lamb shawerma in the pictures that looked more like a burrito. 

I could not believe. How could these hipster DSLRs make a shawerma look like a big burrito? (insert inappropiate dirty jokes here...) True to form, they are very burrito-like. They have a schedule where they serve either chicken or lamb shawermas on certain days. The owners/workers were incredibly patient as I decided which of the 5 menu items to eat.  Make sure to check out the beverages as well. They stock one of my favorite ginger ales.

Parking can be tough in the area and if it's a cold day the only viable seating is the counter which can seat only 5 or 6.

excerpts: The Lamb Shawerma with spicy sauce is SO FREAKIN' YUMMY!
The wrap is always busting out with meat.
lamb shawerma.author: Cherylynn N.
lamb shawerma.review:
Probably the best Shawerma I've ever had, And, if I weren't watching my carbs, I would come here every week. :P

The Lamb Shawerma with spicy sauce is SO FREAKIN' YUMMY! The wrap is always busting out with meat. It will definately leave you satisfied. 

The only problems are parking can be nightmare in the area and there's barely any seating.  So, a good place for take-out!

excerpts: We ordered a falafel, lamb shawerma gyros, baklava, and bottled orange cream soda.
lamb shawerma.author: Cindy W.
lamb shawerma.review:
Mediocre all around.

We ordered a falafel, lamb shawerma gyros, baklava, and bottled orange cream soda. The orange cream soda was the best part of the meal...

Falafel was okay but not hot temperature wise. Shawerma was flavorful but I didn't like the flavor. I personally don't like the thin lavash bread and prefer pita. There was a lot of cucumbers but I think the wraps needed the creamy yogurt flavor of tzatziki. Hot sauce wasn't hot. Baklava was dry and overpriced.

Soda was good.

excerpts: Two words: lamb shawerma.
Amazing.
Generous portions, full of flavor all at a great price.
My friend had the falafel which he loved as well.
I will definitely be coming back.
lamb shawerma.author: Navid P.
lamb shawerma.review: Two words: lamb shawerma. Amazing. Generous portions, full of flavor all at a great price. My friend had the falafel which he loved as well.  I will definitely be coming back.

excerpts: Collectively we ordered the lamb shawerma, lamb kabob, and the Athens burger.
I ate the lamb shawerma, but tried the other two items.
My only complaint is that our order took FOREVER, because of the Athens Burger.
I don't fault them though, because the guy told us 15-20 minutes for that item, so we were forewarned.
I will not penalize.
The cooks were very polite, and seemed to genuinely care about the food and its quality.
During my wait, one of them asked me how my day was going
The Athens burger is not a traditional burger, but ground sirloin stuffed in a pita pocket.
lamb shawerma.author: Brandon N.
lamb shawerma.review:
Omg, the LAMB, the LAMMMMMMB.

I was with two others. Collectively we ordered the lamb shawerma, lamb kabob, and the Athens burger. I ate the lamb shawerma, but tried the other two items.

My only complaint is that our order took FOREVER, because of the Athens Burger. I don't fault them though, because the guy told us 15-20 minutes for that item, so we were forewarned. I will not penalize. The cooks were very polite, and seemed to genuinely care about the food and its quality. During my wait, one of them asked me how my day was going and if I wanted something to eat/drink while I waited.

The LaMBBBBbbBBb. It was fantastic, freshly sliced, and not dry. I attribute this to the joint being super busy on a Saturday night. My shawerma was incredible. There was so much meat packed into the perfectly crisp flatbread, accented with awesome tomatoes and an INCREDIBLE tahini sauce. I ate my shawerma outside, and the ground looked like a Jackson Pollock painting - tahini sauce spackling the cement. I devoured it with extreme prejudice.

The Athens burger is not a traditional burger, but ground sirloin stuffed in a pita pocket. It was fantastic.

I am a fan of the Mediterranean burritos served at this fine establishment. I'm glad I came on a lamb night. There was some crazy fighting that happened a bit down the road too, which provided some mid-meal entertainment.

For what it is: Mediterranean-on-the-fly, this place is superb.

excerpts: Love the lamb shawerma - tender with a kick!
lamb shawerma.author: Stan L.
lamb shawerma.review: Love the lamb shawerma - tender with a kick! The Athens burger is a good twist on a traditional burger (wrap with cucumber), and moist & tasty. Place is small, so not really a sit down w/ friends.

excerpts: They either do Lamb shawerma or chicken depending on the day (never both) and also make falafel (I'm partial to my mom's falafel, which is hands down the best falafel i've had) which is pretty good.
lamb shawerma.author: Mike K.
lamb shawerma.review:
My favorite Shawerma place in SF! The guys here are awesome and can always be counted on making great food at a very good price. They either do Lamb shawerma or chicken depending on the day (never both) and also make falafel (I'm partial to my mom's falafel, which is hands down the best falafel i've had) which is pretty good.

It's a shame I don't eat here more often, but when I crave that comfort food that only some spit roasted shawerma can fix you better believe I'm going to Truly Mediterranean.

excerpts: The lamb shawerma - recommended in 7x7 for the Big Eat - is definitely delicious.
It may be pricey, at $9.30, but worth it.
Make sure not to stop by on Tuesdays or Fridays because they don't serve lamb on those days.
lamb shawerma.author: Chad S.
lamb shawerma.review: The lamb shawerma - recommended in 7x7 for the Big Eat - is definitely delicious.  It may be pricey, at $9.30, but worth it.  Make sure not to stop by on Tuesdays or Fridays because they don't serve lamb on those days.

excerpts: My personal favorite is the lamb shawerma though; it's the Greek's answer to burrito
and I love lamb.
It's spiced well and the hot sauce is amazing.
lamb shawerma.author: Handoyo S.
lamb shawerma.review:
One of our go-to place when we're in need of a quick food. It's just 5-10 minutes away from our house and they always prepare the take-out order very quickly.

The falafel deserves all the fame it's getting. It's crispy and delicious. We always get the Mediterranean combo plate as it has a little bit of everything. The Baba Ghannouj (Eggplant paste) is great, as well as the hummus.

My personal favorite is the lamb shawerma though; it's the Greek's answer to burrito and I love lamb. It's spiced well and the hot sauce is amazing.

excerpts: We ordered the lamb shawerma, it's delicious/most, $9'sh each.
lamb shawerma.author: Jer W.
lamb shawerma.review: My friends and I went here on 4-13-14 9:30pm'sh.  We ordered the lamb shawerma, it's delicious/most, $9'sh each.  I wanted the chicken shawerma (but only available on tuesdays+fridays). My friend ordered the baklava (Mediterranean pastry), flaky/sweet.

excerpts: However, after trying the lamb shawerma, my boyfriend and I love this place!!
We always get the shawerma, at least once a week.
I prefer it with chicken, but it's only served Tuesdays and Fridays, but thats no big deal.
I kind of like it, it makes it more special.
lamb shawerma.author: Caitlin D.
lamb shawerma.review:
Being new to Mediterranean food, I was hesitant to go here at first.  However, after trying the lamb shawerma, my boyfriend and I love this place!!  We always get the shawerma, at least once a week.  I prefer it with chicken, but it's only served Tuesdays and Fridays, but thats no big deal.  I kind of like it, it makes it more special.  I have my special "Tuseday Night Chicken Shawerma" haha.  They serve lamb all other days of the week.  
It's never too packed (even though it can feel like it because the place is so tiny.  No complaints though), and everyone who works there is super friendly and helpful, if you have questions.  The food is always hot and delicious, the perfect comfort food after a long day.

excerpts: i can't rave though because i got a botched family style order and i ended up getting a side of dry, flavorless lamb shawerma with pita.
i can't speak to how the wraps usually taste, but it was the same meat which makes me think the meats may have been overhyped.
lamb shawerma.author: Cailin H.
lamb shawerma.review: i'm far from a connoisseur of mediterranean food but even i could tell the hummus and falafel were special!  i even loved the mediterranean sampler and i don't usually like tabbouleh. i can't rave though because i got a botched family style order and i ended up getting a side of dry, flavorless lamb shawerma with pita. i can't speak to how the wraps usually taste, but it was the same meat which makes me think the meats may have been overhyped.

excerpts: We all had ordered the lamb shawerma.
At $8 it's a bit pricey.
However, the wrap is rather big and the lamb was very juicy and tasty.
lamb shawerma.author: Andrew C.
lamb shawerma.review:
A small hole in the wall place, but worth a taste.

I went here at night with a couple friends. We all had ordered the lamb shawerma. At $8 it's a bit pricey. However, the wrap is rather big and the lamb was very juicy and tasty. I wish it was more spicy though.

If you're gonna get the lamb be aware that they don't serve it on Tuesday and Friday. On those days they serve the chicken shawerma instead.

excerpts: I had the lamb shawerma with a side of hummus.
The shawerma wrap was amazing.
It was very tasty and juicy.
The hummus was also very very good.
lamb shawerma.author: David C.
lamb shawerma.review:
I tried shawerma for the first time every today.  Me and a buddy of mine had to after watching "The Averngers".   I had the lamb shawerma with a side of hummus.  The shawerma wrap was amazing.  It was very tasty and juicy.  The hummus was also very very good.  I am a huge hummus fan, and this hummus is GOOD.

I would highly recommend this place to anyone!  Parking kinda sucks but that goes with just about anywhere in the city.  The staff were all friendly and the food was made up fast.  I will definitely go again.

excerpts: I was disappointed to not have my favorite Lamb Shawerma
but the chicken was pretty good too.
Just thinking about this place
and I'm ready to fly back to San Francisco and have another.
lamb shawerma.author: Allison J.
lamb shawerma.review:
Drunken nights back in the mid-90s... chilly Sunday walks from Delores Park... a quick bite to eat before hopping on the 22... This place is part of the tapestry of my life in San Francisco. 

In May 2007 I returned to my beloved hole-in-the-wall to be greeted with the familiar aromas and flavors I dream about when I'm away. One shawerma just isn't enough. I always buy two so I can eat one on the way home and have another for later.

I was disappointed to not have my favorite Lamb Shawerma but the chicken was pretty good too. Just thinking about this place and I'm ready to fly back to San Francisco and have another.

excerpts:
I love this place, I actually drove couple of times from San Jose to San Francisco just to eat there and drive back, haha

Their lamb shawerma is the best thing to get there
lamb shawerma.author: Rami A.
lamb shawerma.review:
I love this place, I actually drove couple of times from San Jose to San Francisco just to eat there and drive back, haha

Their lamb shawerma is the best thing to get there and there flafel is pretty good as well. If your craving good shawerma or good flafel just drop by and try it.

excerpts: Came here with an online deal, ordered spicy lamb shawerma & hummus.
It was good but could be much better.
I was going to get the taboula but decided not to when I saw how small the container was for the price, I also saw there wasn't much tomato or cucumber-
parsley and bulgur doesnt equal taboula.
As for the hummus it was good- a little pricey
but I've gotten use to that in San Francisco.
The Shawerma was okay.
I've been spoiled with the authentic stuff and places that have come close to over sea's on the East Coast.
For being in a big city and on the West Coast I'd give this a B-.
It has good flavor but tastes like something I could make at home and was more like a fajita than the shawerma I usually eat.
It was also pricey for just a sandwich.
Im use to $6-7 for shawerma with fries or a side.
Close to $10 for just a sandwich that wasn't fully loaded and
no sides, I wouldn't order this without an online deal.
lamb shawerma.author: Bint H.
lamb shawerma.review: Came here with an online deal, ordered spicy lamb shawerma & hummus. It was good but could be much better. I was going to get the taboula but decided not to when I saw how small the container was for the price, I also saw there wasn't much tomato or cucumber- parsley and bulgur doesnt equal taboula. As for the hummus it was good- a little pricey but I've gotten use to that in San Francisco. The Shawerma was okay. I've been spoiled with the authentic stuff and places that have come close to over sea's on the East Coast. For being in a big city and on the West Coast I'd give this a B-. It has good flavor but tastes like something I could make at home and was more like a fajita than the shawerma I usually eat. It was also pricey for just a sandwich. Im use to $6-7 for shawerma with fries or a side. Close to $10 for just a sandwich that wasn't fully loaded and no sides, I wouldn't order this without an online deal.

excerpts: Big Eat #97 Lamb Shawerma at Truly Mediterranean.
MEH
I think the main problem here was that the lamb was dry and the price was about $9 after tax.
I was expecting juicy chunks of lamb, but I got dry bits that were cut up a little too fine
so it tasted almost like... dirt.
lamb shawerma.author: Charles L.
lamb shawerma.review:
7X7 Big Eat #97 Lamb Shawerma at Truly Mediterranean. MEH I think the main problem here was that the lamb was dry and the price was about $9 after tax. I was expecting juicy chunks of lamb, but I got dry bits that were cut up a little too fine so it tasted almost like... dirt. Fuuuu.

The lavash-burrito-style wrap didn't help much either to the wrap as it also added to the dryness overall. The people working there were nice and able to separate the wrap into two separate smaller wraps, but the price didn't really feel right for what we were eating.

Beginning to think this 7X7 Big Eat list is pretty unreliable goshhh.

excerpts: I can only conclude that his lamb shawerma was so good, he did not want to leave.
lamb shawerma.author: Lindsay M.
lamb shawerma.review:
My boyfriend got the metal button on his rear pant pocket seriously stuck in gap between white plastic chair slats outside Truly Med on 16th and Valencia on a busy Saturday afternoon. I can only conclude that his lamb shawerma was so good, he did not want to leave. 

Best best falafel in the area: It is crisp on the outside, delightful on the inside, has excellent flavor and spice -  definitely not soaked in grease to make up for lack of taste like some other places around here. 

+ tahini sauce is awesome - not bitter, very flavorful. 
+ hot sauce is even better!!**
+ combo plate is generous and well-appointed! Unlike other joints where you have to pick 3 items only, you get some of everything here (dolma, falafel, pita, humous, baba ganoush, cucumber salad, huge feta chunks, tabuleh..). Get one and eat it in the park.
+ falafel wrap is killer. Lavash is grilled to perfection.

**If you ask for extra hot sauce for your giant wrap, they will give you a pokey stick object to ensure you get all that hot sauce into your wrap and evenly distributed. 

The atmosphere is not exactly scenic, but the guys at the counter are always smiling... even when your partner person is threatening to abscond with one of their cheap plastic chairs because it is stuck to his arse.

excerpts: I had the lamb Shawerma (delicious) and 1 delicious falafel
and I recommend it to anyone looking for a quick tasty bite in the area especially if they want to walk with their meal.
lamb shawerma.author: Alex W.
lamb shawerma.review:
I will someday eat again at Truly Mediterranean... 

I had the lamb Shawerma (delicious) and 1 delicious falafel and I recommend it to anyone looking for a quick tasty bite in the area especially if they want to walk with their meal.

excerpts: Ahhhhh Truly Mediterranean, I was so looking forward to your lamb shawerma but the first bite I took had a huge piece of hair in it.
Now, I do not mind if Truly Mediterranean is a hole in the wall restaurant because most authentic restaurants are but so long as it keeps up with its health standards.
Eeekk no thank you.
Perhaps another day Truly Medierranean when your health standards are pulled up a notch.
lamb shawerma.author: Megan D.
lamb shawerma.review: Ahhhhh Truly Mediterranean, I was so looking forward to your lamb shawerma but the first bite I took had a huge piece of hair in it. :( Now, I do not mind if Truly Mediterranean is a hole in the wall restaurant because most authentic restaurants are but so long as it keeps up with its health standards. Eeekk no thank you. Perhaps another day Truly Medierranean when your health standards are pulled up a notch.

excerpts: I had no idea what the heck I was in for, but the lamb shawerma is on the Big Eats SF list
so I plopped down my $8, waited a few minutes and VIOLA, I was handed what appeared to be a Mediterranean burrito.
lamb shawerma.author: Elizabeth H.
lamb shawerma.review:
I had no idea what the heck I was in for, but the lamb shawerma is on the Big Eats SF list so I plopped down my $8, waited a few minutes and VIOLA, I was handed what appeared to be a Mediterranean burrito. More specifically, a BABY SHEEP burrito.

It was good but not OMG I NEED TO EAT MORE BABY SHEEP BURRITOS good and it wasn't until I was about halfway through it that it really started to grow on me. Now it's the next day and I'm stitting here thinking about how delicious another baby sheep burrito would be.

Friendly service and delicious baby sheep burritos.

Baa.

excerpts: 3.5..Tried the lamb shawerma.
Loved the way it was spiced.
The lamb was a bit dry and the tomatoes tasted off.
It was made as a wrap
and I should have ordered it on pita.
The lamb kebab was probably the better way to go.
The people working there are very nice.
The sandwich is huge and a good value at 9 bucks.
Get it to go..
lamb shawerma.author: Bleep S.
lamb shawerma.review: 3.5..Tried the lamb shawerma.Loved the way it was spiced.The lamb was a bit dry and the tomatoes tasted off.It was made as a wrap and I should have ordered it on pita.The lamb kebab was probably the better way to go. The people working there are very nice.The sandwich is huge and a good value at 9 bucks. Get it to go..

excerpts:
Truly Unspectacular

Entering, my stomach growled in delight, as the lamb shawerma boldly presents itself in the doorway, slowly roasting, dripping its succulent juices on itself.
lamb shawerma.author: Alissa A.
lamb shawerma.review:
Truly Mediterranean = Truly Unspectacular

Entering, my stomach growled in delight, as the lamb shawerma boldly presents itself in the doorway, slowly roasting, dripping its succulent juices on itself. I planned on a chicken kebab wrap but after a minute engulfed in the scent of lamb, my mind was made up - an order of shawerma could not be passed up.

When the counter-help taking my order, does a 180 for the grill and grabs what looks like a metal cake pan full of cut shawerma and tomatoes and forks over a heap into my to-go dinner container, I wonder about the juicy spit I was drooling over.

At first bite, I had to wonder, was the lamb spit I was sold on for show not for go? A tease. Blasphemy! Not expecting smoking hot as the food was a to-go order, the meat was barely luke warm and had quite a bit of chew to it. Seems as though this pan atop the grill was merely a vessel rather than a means for keeps the meat hot, juicy, and delicious. Re-heating the meat at this point yielded only a slight improvement but was mostly a lost cause. The lamb's accompaniments added bulk (and the glorious onion breath we all desire) to the meal but not much else.

To scoop up smooth, but not overly creamy, and yes, quite flavorful hummus, we received oodles of heated pitas. Quantity does not make up for quality though and while the hummus hit the spot, the rest of the meal left me longing. If I were to go back, I'm just going to sink my teeth into the spit and tear off a chunk of that which I drooled over initially. Such a disappointment.

excerpts: I ordered the lamb shawerma as others had commented.
To my surprise instead of cutting the meat from the rotating hunk of meat they went into a pre cut metal container.
Who knows when this was actually cut.
Based on the taste it could have been from the previous day.
I found the food old, dry, and tasteless.
No thank you.
oh, the place is also very dirty.

excerpts: Love the Lamb Shawerma, lots of flavors combined!
We will soon come back !
lamb shawerma.author: Veronica M.
lamb shawerma.review:
Great little place!
Love the Lamb Shawerma, lots of flavors combined!
We will soon come back !

excerpts: I literally drive 2 hours to satisfy a lamb shawerma craving from truly med.

*** Chicken Shawerma: first blood II

Pulled the rare "back-to-backer" with madre y padre in town, Thursday featured the usual suspect... an ode to spicy lamb shawerma bliss (1st time asking for it "extra spicy" which produced a tongue salivating pleasure-to-pain ratio of about 4-1, perfect) that delighted all but the Stagecoach inn maid.
lamb shawerma.author: Roadtrip B.
lamb shawerma.review:
I literally drive 2 hours to satisfy a lamb shawerma craving from truly med. the spicy red sauce is as epic as the red spice is mysterious?

Haven't found one a tenth as good anywhere within 45 minutes of Sacramento, and not for lack of effort . Soggy-assed tahini and lettuce filled "wraps" is what we keep getting.  Limp dissapointments incapable of producing anticipation or cravings.

I actually bring a huge sheet of heavy duty foil, go to truly med to stare longingly at my "lamb burro" being grilled (insert soft harp music here), wrap it tight in the foil, mad dash to post up at the marin headlands overlooking a foggy GG.... and rehash the "...take me now" feelings that magically combine with the harmony of culinary artistry and  ambience.

*** edit 12/11/09...  the mystical red spice that dusts the grilled onions and tomatoes has been positively IDd (with noted fervor by the Truly Med crew I might add... thanks for the tip, appreciated!)  as "sumac" 

Courtesy SpiceDepot.com  - "The sumac dried berry is not the poison sumac tree leaf, of course, but instead is a berry on a shrub that has grown wild in the Middle East since Neolithic times. It's sold as a reddish dried fruit that found in many Middle Eastern and Greek groceries in the form of a brick."

**** Chicken Shawerma: first blood II

Pulled the rare "back-to-backer" with madre y padre in town, Thursday featured the usual suspect... an ode to spicy lamb shawerma bliss (1st time asking for it "extra spicy" which produced a tongue salivating pleasure-to-pain ratio of about 4-1, perfect) that delighted all but the Stagecoach inn maid. Friday was the dreaded day of reckoning... 

Much like an understood mistress, I'd always known that there was this "other" shawerma,  yet I had always found myself inescapably blinded to variety by my craving for their grilledlamb. I had hoped  against hope that these poultry "infidels" were merely an option on tuesdays and fridays.... negative ghostrider. 

It's pollo time.... shiznit.... woe is me.... 
But wait, it has a "garlic yogurt" sauce replacing the tahini.... very interesting... hope springs eternal.

Verdict: while a breezy, almost sultry afternoon on Treasure Island sprung for extremely complimentary ambiance, the chicken shawerma failed to live up to the limited hype I had bestowed upon it. Even with the always appreciated extra red sauce, the lack of flavor depth in the chicken (through no fault of Truly Med) even as enhanced with garlic, could not hold a candle to its Baa Baa Black Sheep compatriot. 

lesson learned: while variety is indeed the spice of life, habitual use of sumac applied to a lamb burrito from the gods can make everyday remarkable.

excerpts: The lamb shawerma was great and large enough to split.
Way better than Park Gyros.
And the humus and pita bread was also very tasty.
I would eat here again.
lamb shawerma.author: Christy L.
lamb shawerma.review: The lamb shawerma was great and large enough to split.  Way better than Park Gyros.  And the humus and pita bread was also very tasty.  I would eat here again.

excerpts: Went back and got a lamb shawerma and mediterranean combo plate.
They were good, though the meat was a bit tough and chewy.
But.
I change my mind about this place.
I'm gonna toss a couple extra stars their way.
lamb shawerma.author: Diana Y.
lamb shawerma.review:
Falafel Deluxe.
Exploded after 4 bites.
It was not tasty.  

I am sad.  

So I write haiku about my sadness.

*************************************
UPDATE: 06/28/2007

Went back and got a lamb shawerma and mediterranean combo plate.  They were good, though the meat was a bit tough and chewy.  But.  I change my mind about this place.  I'm gonna toss a couple extra stars their way.

excerpts: The other days they have lamb shawerma, which I ordered once and never again.
Don't they understand it's the chicken they excel at?
I totally agree with the comment "I have driven with my knees to scarf down this meal."
In fact, I also add a little improvised placemat to catch any drippings that may seep out the bottom of the foil wrapper.
lamb shawerma.author: Ian G.
lamb shawerma.review:
The best chicken shawerma (spelling varies, but since they make the best, I spell it like they do) in the universe.  For some reason it's only available on Tuesday and Friday.  I used to drive over from the East Bay and bring them back for lunch.  The other days they have lamb shawerma, which I ordered once and never again.  Don't they understand it's the chicken they excel at?  I totally agree with the comment "I have driven with my knees to scarf down this meal."  In fact, I also add a little improvised placemat to catch any drippings that may seep out the bottom of the foil wrapper.  Oh yeah, their falafel deluxe is good too, maybe the best outside of Israel, but if it's a Chicken Shawerma day I can't be bothered with anything else!

UPDATE: I ate here again after a long absence, and they made me a "shawerrito" -- that's a crappy chicken shawerma made by an all-Mexican staff playing salsa music. It was NOT GOOD. Truly Mediterranean is no longer True or Mediterranean.

excerpts: When I get a lamb shawerma craving, nothing else will do.
Got to get it extra spicy
, otherwise it's a little bland.
Out the door for less than $10 is also part of its awesomeness.
lamb shawerma.author: Julie T.
lamb shawerma.review: When I get a lamb shawerma craving, nothing else will do.  Got to get it extra spicy, otherwise it's a little bland.  Out the door for less than $10 is also part of its awesomeness.

excerpts: I'd like to take this opportunity to direct your attention to a burrito of another type... a delicious lamb shawerma.
lamb shawerma.author: Steven R.
lamb shawerma.review:
I know how it goes.  

You're hungry.

You're in the Mission.

You're thinking "I need a burrito!"

I'd like to take this opportunity to direct your attention to a burrito of another type... a delicious lamb shawerma.  I came and got one and was not disappointed, it was consistently delicious, meaty and about the size of any of  the titanic burritos I would've normally been seeking in the Mission.

Truly Mediterranean is definitely on my radar for a quick mission meal.

excerpts: The first time there, I ordered a lamb shawerma and chose to eat it there--on the cushioned stools, facing the mirror.
Being a complete newbie, I didn't realize that there was only one correct end to open the tin foil.
I opened mine from the bottom (wrong side).
Just when I was about the dive in, the cashier quickly caught my attention, and rushed over to re-wrap my shawerma with tin foil.
The top (correct end) is open, you see, and had the cashier not saved me, I would have been left with bits of lamb, yogurt sauce, onions, etc. falling onto on my lap.
Great service--even from behind the counter!
The second time, I got the lamb shawerma again.
Opened it up from the top end.
lamb shawerma.author: Rona J.
lamb shawerma.review:
Yesterday marked my 3rd visit to Truly Med since I was first introduced a month ago. Credits go to the BF who have been frequenting here for quite some time. 

The first time there, I ordered a lamb shawerma and chose to eat it there--on the cushioned stools, facing the mirror. Being a complete newbie, I didn't realize that there was only one correct end to open the tin foil. I opened mine from the bottom (wrong side).  Just when I was about the dive in, the cashier quickly caught my attention, and rushed over to re-wrap my shawerma with tin foil. The top (correct end) is open, you see, and had the cashier not saved me, I would have been left with bits of lamb, yogurt sauce, onions, etc. falling onto on my lap. Great service--even from behind the counter! The shawerma was delicious with just the right amount of seasoning and tenderness of the meat. 

The second time, I got the lamb shawerma again. Opened it up from the top end. No mishaps there except the mess I made from devouring the thing.

Yesterday, my third time, I was lucky enough to go on a chicken day (Tuesdays and Fridays). Got the chicken shawerma (with hot sauce, of course). Once again, lived up to expectations..and in fact, I like the chicken more than the lamb. Need to make a mental note to visit more frequently on chicken days. 

Make sure to get the hot sauce! Always. 

And remember, even though this place is in the Mission, the shawerma isn't a burrito. That means...there is only one correct end to eat it from.

excerpts: Worth the trip from anywhere on a Tuesday or Friday for Chicken Shawerma, the rest of the week, have the Lamb Shawerma and a Ginger Beer.
lamb shawerma.author: Mark W.
lamb shawerma.review: Worth the trip from anywhere on a Tuesday or Friday for Chicken Shawerma, the rest of the week, have the Lamb Shawerma and a Ginger Beer.

excerpts: Best spicy lamb shawerma ever.
End of story.
Makes me sad there's not a Truly Mediterranean in Vegas.
lamb shawerma.author: Megan O.
lamb shawerma.review: Read rave reviews about this place prior to leaving for a vacation to San Francisco, so I made a mental note to check it out once I was in town. Best spicy lamb shawerma ever. End of story. Makes me sad there's not a Truly Mediterranean in Vegas.

excerpts: The lamb shawerma is the best I've ever had.

excerpts: I have had the falafel, hummus, lamb shawerma (my personal favorite!), and graiybeh (butter cookie).
I've tried the lamb shawerma with different combinations on the inside, from eggplant to onions, sometimes with the spicy sauce, sometimes without.
Every time I have gotten it, the meat has been tender and flavorful!

Portions are a good size (sometimes I eat the shawerma in two sittings, depending on how hungry I am when I get there), Ingredients are fresh (you see them cook the lamb/chicken, and falafel right there!)
lamb shawerma.author: Jenn J.
lamb shawerma.review:
I have been to Truly Mediterranean at least 6 times and I have never been disappointed! I have had the falafel, hummus, lamb shawerma (my personal favorite!), and graiybeh (butter cookie). I've tried the lamb shawerma with different combinations on the inside, from eggplant to onions, sometimes with the spicy sauce, sometimes without. Every time I have gotten it, the meat has been tender and flavorful! Portions are a good size (sometimes I eat the shawerma in two sittings, depending on how hungry I am when I get there), Ingredients are fresh (you see them cook the lamb/chicken, and falafel right there!) and the service is fast!

It's a pretty small place right there on 16th and Valencia, right there in the Mission District! There is a 4 or 5-stool bar inside and a few tables outside so you can enjoy the warm weather. The hours are great, and for those who don't eat lamb, they have chicken shawermas on Tuesdays and Fridays. There are so many options for such a small place, and the owners and employees are some of the nicest around!

I've tried other middle eastern places around the city, and Truly Med has proven the best by far! (The only thing better is my grandmother's Arabic food!)

If you haven't tried it already, GO! If you haven't liked it in the past, I suggest you try it again. I honestly always leave happy and full!

excerpts: Plain and simple, the spicy lamb shawerma is about as good as a shawerma gets.
This spot is a hole in the wall, but don't let the outward appearance fool you.
lamb shawerma.author: Grant L.
lamb shawerma.review: Plain and simple, the spicy lamb shawerma is about as good as a shawerma gets. This spot is a hole in the wall, but don't let the outward appearance fool you.

excerpts: Everyone writes about the lamb shawerma, I'm not a huge fan of lamb, but I can say their chicken kabob wrap is heavenly.
I mean, soooo good.
lamb shawerma.author: Lauren B.
lamb shawerma.review: Everyone writes about the lamb shawerma, I'm not a huge fan of lamb, but I can say their chicken kabob wrap is heavenly. I mean, soooo good. On Tuesday and Fridays they switch out the lamb for chicken shawerma which I like much less than the Kabob, but still good. All in all, really good huge wraps of Mediterranean deliciousness. I always ask for extra spicy but that's just my thing...

excerpts: The lamb shawerma is also great.
The lamb/beef combo is bold, well-seasoned, and moist.
The tomato, onion, and tahini really bring out the flavor of the meat.
For a "truly mediterranean" dining experience, you can't go wrong with the combo plate.
Love the hummus and baba.
The feta cheese and cucumber salad were very fresh.
I'm not a huge fan of taboleh or dolmas but they seam to be on par with the other items on the plate.
Overall, this place rocks.
The only negative is the price.
9 dollars for a wrap is a bit much to spend.
You do get a lot of bang, but you will have to spend a lot of bucks.
lamb shawerma.author: Siao W.
lamb shawerma.review:
How do they make chick peas taste so good? At truly mediterranean, you can watch them make these delicious balls called falafels. The falafel deluxe is awesome. The salad, tahini, onions, eggplant and potatoes provide multiple layers of flavor to compliment the delicious falafel. I can't think of a better falafel sandwich.
     The lamb shawerma is also great. The lamb/beef combo is bold, well-seasoned, and moist. The tomato, onion, and tahini really bring out the flavor of the meat.
     For a "truly mediterranean" dining experience, you can't go wrong with the combo plate. Love the hummus and baba. The feta cheese and cucumber salad were very fresh. I'm not a huge fan of taboleh or dolmas but they seam to be on par with the other items on the plate.
     Overall, this place rocks. The only negative is the price. 9 dollars for a wrap is a bit much to spend. You do get a lot of bang, but you will have to spend a lot of bucks.

excerpts: Had the Chicken Kabab and a taste of the Lamb Shawerma.
Both delicious.
Uber friendly staff.
lamb shawerma.author: Jenny X.
lamb shawerma.review: This place was good. Had the Chicken Kabab and a taste of the Lamb Shawerma. Both delicious. Uber friendly staff.

excerpts: I will come back and try the lamb shawerma next time around.
lamb shawerma.author: K L.
lamb shawerma.review:
I wanted to eat at a hole in the wall and I found it. The place is tiny and there's a line which is always a good sign. Service is fast!

My friend and I went inside, we ordered chicken shawerma (they didn't serve lamb on certain days) and deluxe falafel.

What we should have done was order just one item. But you know girls, our eyes are bigger than our stomach. 

The chicken shawerma was good. Falafel was lacking in flavor and we had to asked for more hot sauce. All the ingredients  are fresh.

I will come back and try the lamb shawerma next time around.

excerpts: I kept going back and trying different things - lamb shawerma, kefta kabab,
falafel - none were bad, they were just all boring and tasteless.
lamb shawerma.author: Gordon B.
lamb shawerma.review:
I really wanted to like this place, I'd kill for a good shawerma. I kept going back and trying different things - lamb shawerma, kefta kabab, falafel - none were bad, they were just all boring and tasteless. After a few tries I'm giving up.

I don't know where all these good reviews are coming from. I guess everyone is eating here drunk? If I'd been drunk I probably would have liked it too.

excerpts: I had the lamb Shawerma with extra hot sauce and it is GREAT!
lamb shawerma.author: Ashley T.
lamb shawerma.review:
This place is excellent as long as you are not expecting to sit down and eat in. I had the lamb Shawerma with extra hot sauce and it is GREAT! I like this place better than Ali Baba's Cave, if you are at 19th I say walk the extra blocks for the best!

Plus the place scored a 99 from the dept of health!  a clean hole in the wall is hard to find.

excerpts: They serve either chicken or lamb shawerma depending on the day (I'll report back on which days are which.)
I tried the garlic, yogurt & mint drink last time
I was there.
It was great, not salty
(I just don't dig the salty ones) but it was pretty garlicy.
Seriously, you would not want to have an important meeting or date later in the day, but it was tasty.
lamb shawerma.author: Tina D.
lamb shawerma.review:
Consistently delicious!  This is absolutely my go-to place when I'm ravenous and in no mood to wait more than a couple minutes.  I get the falafel regular, extra spicy, because it's really not that hot.  They wrap it in lavash and then grill it which, in my opinion, is the mark of a quality med wrap.

Kabobs take a while because they grill them fresh to order.  I always see people in there waiting for kebabs.  They serve either chicken or lamb shawerma depending on the day (I'll report back on which days are which.)  I tried the garlic, yogurt & mint drink last time I was there.  It was great, not salty (I just don't dig the salty ones) but it was pretty garlicy.  Seriously, you would not want to have an important meeting or date later in the day, but it was tasty.

excerpts: I had a falafel and a lamb shawerma.
The spices that were with/in the lamb were amazing.
The meat itself was a little bit on the muttony side, but it still tasted delicious.
And while I have had better falafel, that was not in the US, so I won't hold it against them.
Also do try the yogurt drink, it sounds weird (garlic and all), but it's refreshing.
lamb shawerma.author: Martin W.
lamb shawerma.review: This is the best Falafel/Shawerma place I have found in SF so far. I had a falafel and a lamb shawerma. The spices that were with/in the lamb were amazing. The meat itself was a little bit on the muttony side, but it still tasted delicious. And while I have had better falafel, that was not in the US, so I won't hold it against them. Also do try the yogurt drink, it sounds weird (garlic and all), but it's refreshing.

excerpts: Lamb Shawerma?

I have only been once, and im sure that i will try the other items on the menu, but for now just eat that!
I LOVE YELP, it is a tried and true way to find great food!
After reading some of the reviews, i had to once again see what the hype was all about.
This place is inexpensive, fast, and probably one of the best bangs for your buck in this city or ANYWHERE!!
Make sure what ever you get
you get it
SPICY, and

if your lucky to find a seat in the cramped and busy location take it, you don't want walking to distract you from the Shawerma, or rather you don't want to be distracted by the Shawerma while walking....dangerous!
I will be a long time customer, and thank you Yelpers for the recommendations, you rock!

excerpts: the Lamb shawerma was very good and the service was excellent and very fast, I can tell this place gets lots of business, they even have home made yogurt drinks.
lamb shawerma.author: Mr Bolo B.
lamb shawerma.review:
a nice & friendly little place, but has only enough room for 5 people with a narrow counter inside and one outside table

the Lamb shawerma was very good and the service was excellent and very fast, I can tell this place gets lots of business, they even have home made yogurt drinks.

the menu is kind of small, not too many items, mostly wraps & salads

excerpts: The goodness of the lamb shawerma is indescribable.
The lightly toasted wrap with the juicy lamb and the sauce...
I only wished I lived in SF! 5 stars hands down, must try this place.
lamb shawerma.author: Sophie S.
lamb shawerma.review: The goodness of the lamb shawerma is indescribable. The lightly toasted wrap with the juicy lamb and the sauce...I only wished I lived in SF! 5 stars hands down, must try this place.

excerpts: Possibly the best lamb shawerma I have ever had.
A good price considering the quality and quantity of food.
lamb shawerma.author: Dana L.
lamb shawerma.review: Fabulous falafel and shawerma. Possibly the best lamb shawerma I have ever had. A good price considering the quality and quantity of food.

excerpts: The yogurt garlic drink is awesome with the lamb shawerma, which turns on a spit.
lamb shawerma.author: Nan L.
lamb shawerma.review:
Go for the specialties that Walid provides, this place is not a one trick pony. The yogurt garlic drink is awesome with the lamb shawerma, which turns on a spit. The desserts include walnut or pistachio baklava, never stale.

This place really is Mediterranean, unafraid to offer strong hearty flavors without dumbing them down for patrons from out of town of for the sake of adding in "Euro" blends, so it's not for the faint of heart. It's also a family operation and has been here for years. 

They do a good job catering also and pastries are made fresh for you. I got pastries made for my graduation and they were all eaten. Check it out!

excerpts: Amazing lamb shawerma and falafel sandwich.
Very filling .
Good price .
Will definitely be back .
lamb shawerma.author: Vibhore S.
lamb shawerma.review: Amazing lamb shawerma and falafel sandwich. Very filling . Good price . Will definitely be back .

excerpts: I don't know about anything else on their menu as it would be impossible for me to go there and resist the lamb shawerma.
Anyway, if you like shawermas, this place can't be beat.
lamb shawerma.author: Sam N.
lamb shawerma.review: These guys have the best shawerma in SF, probably in the world.  I'm a big shawerma fan to begin with, but since I've discovered this place I go miles out of my way about once a week just to get one of these.  Their hummous is also top notch.  I don't know about anything else on their menu as it would be impossible for me to go there and resist the lamb shawerma.  Anyway, if you like shawermas, this place can't be beat.

excerpts: Reasonable pricing for dinner fare, about $8 for a lamb shawerma; service is speedy and very friendly, and the place is immaculate for an over-the-counter eatery.
I agree with Giedon K. that this is a Take-Out only place;
the stool and bar for "seating" are far too few and cramped to be able to truly enjoy your meal (plus it's a little weird to stare into a mirror and watch yourself scarf down food...
it's almost like you're having an eating contest with yourself?).
lamb shawerma.author: Jessica L.
lamb shawerma.review:
The spicy sauce "dries out" the shawerma a bit, because it is more pasty than a thick chili liquid, which on the plus side doesn't soak through the wrap and therefore holds well when taking out, but I think next time I'll ask for extra yogurt sauce, which was divine. The meat was succulent--you can see them carve it out of a heaping mound on their rotating spit; just watching it and absorbing all the aroma... mouth watering! The rest of the filling is standard and very complementary; I love what they use for the wrap. Versus a pita or tortilla-esque wrap like some other places, they put it on lavash, a first for me. Awesome, perfect wrapping material.
Reasonable pricing for dinner fare, about $8 for a lamb shawerma; service is speedy and very friendly, and the place is immaculate for an over-the-counter eatery.
I agree with Giedon K. that this is a Take-Out only place; the stool and bar for "seating" are far too few and cramped to be able to truly enjoy your meal (plus it's a little weird to stare into a mirror and watch yourself scarf down food... it's almost like you're having an eating contest with yourself?).
Food a-plenty, I will be back for sure, especially to try out the chicken shawerma which is only served twice a week and therefore, makes it mysterious and worthy of my curiosity.

excerpts: love the lamb shawerma as well as the babaganoush.
lamb shawerma.author: Helen T.
lamb shawerma.review: one of my favorite mediterranean restaurants in the city. love the lamb shawerma as well as the babaganoush.

excerpts: I got some food from Truly Mediterranean for my birthday party -- the appetizer platters, filafels and lamb shawerma.
EVERYTHING was sooooo good, my mouth is watering even when I just think about it.
I know everyone else already commented about it, but I agree -- noone else makes shawerma like this one.
The food was very cheap too -- about $130 for 30 people and we couldn't finish it.
And they let me  place my order just a day in advance, which is totally awesome, because you know, planning in advance is hard ;)
