And they let me  place my order just a day in advance, which is totally awesome, because you know, planning in advance is hard ;)

excerpts: I always have the Falafel Deluxe and my husband the Lamb Shawerma
and it just tasty and delicious.
There are only maybe 6 seats inside the place but we still enjoy eating it there while still fresh from the grill.
But with the foil wrap, they stay warm and toasty still when we take it to Ocean Beach, Marina or the Golden Gate Park.
This place has never failed.
lamb shawerma.author: Mavis G.
lamb shawerma.review: I have been going to this place since my college years in the '90s.  They are really as good as it gets for falafel.  I always have the Falafel Deluxe and my husband the Lamb Shawerma and it just tasty and delicious.  There are only maybe 6 seats inside the place but we still enjoy eating it there while still fresh from the grill.  But with the foil wrap, they stay warm and toasty still when we take it to Ocean Beach, Marina or the Golden Gate Park.  This place has never failed.

excerpts: Hmm, i'm in the hunt for a good donner kebab replacement, and the lamb shawerma was going to be it.
It was good, though, I must admit it didn't bowl me over for a five star rating.
and didn't hit the donner kebab spot.
The 3.5- 4 star partly for the food, esp that they ask you if you want it spicy, and also that they're quick and no fuss.
lamb shawerma.author: Jay S.
lamb shawerma.review:
Hmm, i'm in the hunt for a good donner kebab replacement, and the lamb shawerma was going to be it.  It was good, though, I must admit it didn't bowl me over for a five star rating.  and didn't hit the donner kebab spot. The 3.5- 4 star partly for the food, esp that they ask you if you want it spicy, and also that they're quick and no fuss.  Actually, I think i would have been perfectly happy if they cut my lamb off the skewer (false advertising!), instead of using the precut stuff, and if my lamb was a little less fatty...

The place is really more of a quick stop sort of place, but I see huge potential for late night drunk food.  I bet the chicken shawerma is better than the lamb, but apparently they only serve it on Tues and Fri.  That's silly, i'm sure they could buy another machine and have both...

Next time i'll have to give the falafels a try, maybe that'll give it another star...

excerpts: the lamb shawerma was tasty but
probably not one of the 100 things i need to have eaten in sf before i
died--
also it dripped grease onto a favorite jacket of mine and i do hold that against it
lamb shawerma.author: m t.
lamb shawerma.review: the lamb shawerma was tasty but probably not one of the 100 things i need to have eaten in sf before i died-- also it dripped grease onto a favorite jacket of mine and i do hold that against it

excerpts: the lamb shawerma was amazing!!
a great sauce, good lamb, onions and tomatoes
what else could i ask for..
and it was huge/$8.
everyone working there was so nice
and i enjoyed watching them make all the food.
try it out, you will be very pleased!
lamb shawerma.author: Barbara C.
lamb shawerma.review: i came here for the 1st time yesterday and really enjoyed it, i will definitely be returning next time i want grab and go food in this area! the lamb shawerma was amazing!! a great sauce, good lamb, onions and tomatoes what else could i ask for.. and it was huge/$8. everyone working there was so nice and i enjoyed watching them make all the food. try it out, you will be very pleased!

excerpts: No lie: I loved this Chicken Shawerma as much as I enjoyed my dinner at French Laundry a few months earlier.
I'm not even gonna  calculate how many Chicken Shawerma's I could get (a lifetime's, perhaps?) for the price of that single meal.
The Chicken Shawerma was perfect.
chicken shawerma.author: Tracey A.
chicken shawerma.review:
No lie: I loved this Chicken Shawerma as much as I enjoyed my dinner at French Laundry a few months earlier.  I'm not even gonna  calculate how many Chicken Shawerma's I could get (a lifetime's, perhaps?) for the price of that single meal.  

Peruse the simple menu posted on the wall, order while standing in line, wait at the bar stools, then take your hot, delicious Middle Eastern sandwich somewhere lovely to enjoy it, as sitting in one of the 2 tables out front will only give you a front row seat to the passing craziness of humanity (?) that is 16th Street.

Before sending you on your way with your bagful (under $20 for 2 dinner-sized sandwiches + 2 waters), they roast that baby on the grill, sealing in warmth and goodness from the outside in.  

The Chicken Shawerma was perfect.  The Falafel Deluxe, a lavash-enrobed falafel with roasted eggplant and potatoes, a wee bit less perfect (too many potatoes).  Next time, extra eggplant and no potatoes.

And there will be a next time, most def'.

excerpts: To my disappointment, I discovered that only chicken shawerma is served on Fridays.
Thats
ok
I thought, chicken is harder to muck up versus lamb
right?
I mean chicken is one of the easier meats to cook..
can't be too hard to make it juicy unless it was cooked hours ago and was just sitting around in a cold metal bin..
chicken shawerma.author: Henry W.
chicken shawerma.review:
After hearing all the accolades about the lamb shawerma here, I decided to saunter on in late Friday night. To my disappointment, I discovered that only chicken shawerma is served on Fridays. Thats ok I thought, chicken is harder to muck up versus lamb right? I mean chicken is one of the easier meats to cook.. can't be too hard to make it juicy unless it was cooked hours ago and was just sitting around in a cold metal bin.. Too bad the chicken was in fact sitting in one of those metal bins. 

My shawerma was incredibly dry, room temperature, and bland.. the only thing saving it from my cutting the innards of mouth open were the tomatoes and barely there shawerma sauce. The guys working the counter also didn't want to be there - customer service wasn't obviously on their minds. For $10 and crappy service, I expect to have a decent takeaway meal, especially with so many options nearby in the Mission. How is this place still around?

excerpts: I also like the Chicken Shawerma, but you have to be lucky enough to come on a Tuesday or Friday, because those are the only days they have chicken.
chicken shawerma.author: Rebekah T.
chicken shawerma.review:
This is one of my favorite places to go for a little Mediterranean food. It's a tiny little place with a counter and not much else, but truly a gem in the Mission.

I typically order the Mediterranean Combo Plate which comes with a Falafel, hummus, baba, tabouleh, cucumber salad, dolmas, feta cheese, seasoned onions, tahini sauce, and pita bread. I order this almost everytime I'm here, because I love it. 

I also like the Chicken Shawerma, but you have to be lucky enough to come on a Tuesday or Friday, because those are the only days they have chicken. 

What I love about this place is while we are hanging out at Killowatt watching the game, we pop over and get the plate to go. It's a perfect appetizer for a group of hungry Giants fans.

excerpts: Plus the chicken shawerma only seems to be offered twice a week now.
I'm not sure what happened
but I probably won't be coming back.
chicken shawerma.author: Mahmoud A.
chicken shawerma.review: This place used to be much better. I remember coming here 5+ years ago and it would always hit the spot. Plus the chicken shawerma only seems to be offered twice a week now. I'm not sure what happened but I probably won't be coming back.

excerpts: Still need to try the chicken shawerma (Tuesday/fri only)
but I'm sure it'll impress just the same.
Fresh, well worth the price,
good sized sandwhich
, I will definitely be back again
chicken shawerma.author: Naji S.
chicken shawerma.review: True to the name. Mashallah the tahini is ridiculous I had the lamb shawerma and it was too good tastes just like what one used to getting from back home and even better than some of those places. Still need to try the chicken shawerma (Tuesday/fri only) but I'm sure it'll impress just the same. Fresh, well worth the price, good sized sandwhich, I will definitely be back again

excerpts: I got the Chicken shawerma since they didn't have lamb that day.
They are very generous with the portions here.
It looked like a torpedo.
I added feta to it and hot sauce.
so GOOD!
I want more!
chicken shawerma.author: Phuong K.
chicken shawerma.review:
I recommend sharing.

I stopped by this little place for lunch and me and my friend should've shared, but because we were starved we decided to get our own even though i ate less than half of this thing. 

I got the Chicken shawerma since they didn't have lamb that day. They are very generous with the portions here. It looked like a torpedo. I added feta to it and hot sauce. so GOOD! I want more!

excerpts: I've seen the recommendation for the chicken shawerma but the first time I went, it wasn't a tuesday nor a friday
I did end up trying the chicken shawerma on a future visit as well as the lamb kabob and I found that the lamb wraps were more enjoyable.
I know much of the population doesn't like the gamey lamb taste
but if you do like lamb, you should try out the lamb kabob and shawerma here.
Great mediterranean food.
Highly recommend.
chicken shawerma.author: Keith N.
chicken shawerma.review:
Random Hole in the Wall spot found on yelp when I was looking up places for Mediterranean food. It's a very small restaurant with a walk-up counter to order. There is a small counter opposing from where you order but it only seats about 4 people.  There is also a small table outside that seats 2 so on a beautiful day, it would be nice to eat outside (those are rare in SF).

Fantastic place here found on 16th and Valencia.  I've seen the recommendation for the chicken shawerma but the first time I went, it wasn't a tuesday nor a friday so I ended up going with the lamb shawerma.  It was delicious, especially with the spicy sauce and the yogurt sauce with cucumbers and onions.

I did end up trying the chicken shawerma on a future visit as well as the lamb kabob and I found that the lamb wraps were more enjoyable.  I know much of the population doesn't like the gamey lamb taste but if you do like lamb, you should try out the lamb kabob and shawerma here.  Great mediterranean food. Highly recommend.

excerpts: Chicken Shawerma for 8.25, tip must have been included.
chicken shawerma.author: vin t.
chicken shawerma.review:
Chicken Shawerma for 8.25, tip must have been included.

Good but small, next...

excerpts: I strolled into this tiny eatery with its five stools (and outdoor seating), feeling lucky after finding parking nearby (and no line!) and continued my shawerma quest by ordering the chicken shawerma wrap ($7.50).
It's a shame that you can only get the chicken shawerma on Tuesdays and Fridays though - wish they could squeeze in one more spit.
chicken shawerma.author: Lolia S.
chicken shawerma.review:
I strolled into this tiny eatery with its five stools (and outdoor seating), feeling lucky after finding parking nearby (and no line!) and continued my shawerma quest by ordering the chicken shawerma wrap ($7.50).  

They know what they're doing.  He asked me if I wanted it spicy or not.  No one's ever asked me that before when ordering shawerma though some places have given me hot sauce.  Wow, good sign.  They're very quick too - they spread the hot sauce on the lavash, shave off the chicken from the spit, throw on some yogurt sauce, tomatoes and onions, roll and then throw it on the grill.  My wrap was ready in minutes, which gave me some time to look over their press clippings and awards.

The wrap did not disappoint.  There's just the right amount of delicious garlic yogurt sauce, so that wrap doesn't fall apart and sauce doesn't squirt everywhere.  They give you plenty of chicken which is thinly shaved and seasoned well.  The crunchy seasoned onions, juicy broiled tomatoes and taste of fresh parsley all enhance the taste of the wrap.  As for the hot sauce, I wish it were spicier.

The menu is limited to various wraps and some dips and salads but I like limited menu hole in the wall spots.  It's a shame that you can only get the chicken shawerma on Tuesdays and Fridays though - wish they could squeeze in one more spit.  They have some drinks and some fresh desserts (baklava and some others) too.  

Credit cards accepted.

excerpts: I wanted the chicken shawerma (but only available on tuesdays+fridays).
My friend ordered the baklava (Mediterranean pastry), flaky/sweet.
chicken shawerma.author: Jer W.
chicken shawerma.review: My friends and I went here on 4-13-14 9:30pm'sh.  We ordered the lamb shawerma, it's delicious/most, $9'sh each.  I wanted the chicken shawerma (but only available on tuesdays+fridays). My friend ordered the baklava (Mediterranean pastry), flaky/sweet.

excerpts: I have my special "Tuseday Night Chicken Shawerma" haha.
They serve lamb all other days of the week.
It's never too packed (even though it can feel like it because the place is so tiny.
No complaints though), and everyone who works there is super friendly and helpful, if you have questions.
The food is always hot and delicious, the perfect comfort food after a long day.
chicken shawerma.author: Caitlin D.
chicken shawerma.review:
Being new to Mediterranean food, I was hesitant to go here at first.  However, after trying the lamb shawerma, my boyfriend and I love this place!!  We always get the shawerma, at least once a week.  I prefer it with chicken, but it's only served Tuesdays and Fridays, but thats no big deal.  I kind of like it, it makes it more special.  I have my special "Tuseday Night Chicken Shawerma" haha.  They serve lamb all other days of the week.  
It's never too packed (even though it can feel like it because the place is so tiny.  No complaints though), and everyone who works there is super friendly and helpful, if you have questions.  The food is always hot and delicious, the perfect comfort food after a long day.

excerpts: so we ordered one Deluxe and one Chicken shawerma.
Surprisingly the chicken one was kinda dry but that's okay because the Deluxe makes up for it!
This place seriously makes the best falafel balls I've ever had.
I bring everyone here to try them.
chicken shawerma.author: Helen V.
chicken shawerma.review:
BALLS!!!!

The Deluxe Falafel Schawerma makes me want to become a vegetarian.  What's meat? 

What attracted me to this place was actually the meat roasting in the window as you walk down 16th St. And I love meat.  So I went in and luckily, I had a friend with me so we ordered one Deluxe and one Chicken shawerma.  Surprisingly the chicken one was kinda dry but that's okay because the Deluxe makes up for it! This place seriously makes the best falafel balls I've ever had. I bring everyone here to try them. And add eggplant and potatoes YUMMM

Each Shawerma is sharable but easily capable of being devoured. he perfect combo for me is the half a Deluxe and half a side of Tabouleh.  Bomb dot com dinner right there! I just had one tonight...and I still want one tomorrow.

The staff is friendly and service is quick.  Prices are alright...$8/wrap...  Sucks that there's very minimal seating and not a good place for a "catch up" meal with friends.  But I'm willing to sacrifice! 

BALLS!!!!

excerpts: On those days they serve the chicken shawerma instead.
chicken shawerma.author: Andrew C.
chicken shawerma.review:
A small hole in the wall place, but worth a taste.

I went here at night with a couple friends. We all had ordered the lamb shawerma. At $8 it's a bit pricey. However, the wrap is rather big and the lamb was very juicy and tasty. I wish it was more spicy though.

If you're gonna get the lamb be aware that they don't serve it on Tuesday and Friday. On those days they serve the chicken shawerma instead.

excerpts: Great chicken shawerma.
Loved the sauce in it and how it just oozed out.
And I love how it didn't break apart in my hands and didn't taste super dry like Ali Baba's Cave in Lower Haight.
Major plus.
chicken shawerma.author: April D.
chicken shawerma.review: It's hard to find a good shawerma in the city. After being super disappointed from one place, I was lazy and didn't know where else to go. But on a random walk, stopped here, and was pretty satisfied. Great chicken shawerma. Loved the sauce in it and how it just oozed out. And I love how it didn't break apart in my hands and didn't taste super dry like Ali Baba's Cave in Lower Haight. Major plus.

excerpts: I tried the Chicken Shawerma for the first time today and my entire experience was a wash.
chicken shawerma.author: ubaid d.
chicken shawerma.review:
Here's your contrarian review - I've been visiting Truly Mediterranean for over a year now and in my opinion their quality has steadily deteriorated. I tried the Chicken Shawerma for the first time today and my entire experience was a wash. The gentleman serving the wraps had a gruff demeanor and he was miserly with the sauce. 

The chicken itself was drier than paper and my lunch was pretty much ruined. Not recommended.

excerpts: My fave, however is the chicken shawerma.
Bring your appetite and love for slightly spicy and amazing Mediterranean food.
The chicken shawerma is only served on Tues and Friday though, but dont be afraid of the chicken kabob wrap or the falafel deluxe.
They are both on par with aforementioned chicken shawerma.
chicken shawerma.author: Jbot S.
chicken shawerma.review:
Every thing Ive ever eaten here has been tasty.

My fave, however is the chicken shawerma. Bring your appetite and love for slightly spicy and amazing Mediterranean food.
The chicken shawerma is only served on Tues and Friday though, but dont be afraid of the chicken kabob wrap or the falafel deluxe. They are both on par with aforementioned chicken shawerma.

Do NOT plan on sitting though. There are almost no seats and very limited space.

excerpts:
*** Chicken Shawerma: first blood II

Pulled the rare "back-to-backer" with madre y padre in town, Thursday featured the usual suspect... an ode to spicy lamb shawerma bliss (1st time asking for it "extra spicy" which produced a tongue salivating pleasure-to-pain ratio of about 4-1, perfect) that delighted all but the Stagecoach inn maid.
Verdict: while a breezy, almost sultry afternoon on Treasure Island sprung for extremely complimentary ambiance, the chicken shawerma failed to live up to the limited hype I had bestowed upon it.
chicken shawerma.author: Roadtrip B.
chicken shawerma.review:
I literally drive 2 hours to satisfy a lamb shawerma craving from truly med. the spicy red sauce is as epic as the red spice is mysterious?

Haven't found one a tenth as good anywhere within 45 minutes of Sacramento, and not for lack of effort . Soggy-assed tahini and lettuce filled "wraps" is what we keep getting.  Limp dissapointments incapable of producing anticipation or cravings.

I actually bring a huge sheet of heavy duty foil, go to truly med to stare longingly at my "lamb burro" being grilled (insert soft harp music here), wrap it tight in the foil, mad dash to post up at the marin headlands overlooking a foggy GG.... and rehash the "...take me now" feelings that magically combine with the harmony of culinary artistry and  ambience.

*** edit 12/11/09...  the mystical red spice that dusts the grilled onions and tomatoes has been positively IDd (with noted fervor by the Truly Med crew I might add... thanks for the tip, appreciated!)  as "sumac" 

Courtesy SpiceDepot.com  - "The sumac dried berry is not the poison sumac tree leaf, of course, but instead is a berry on a shrub that has grown wild in the Middle East since Neolithic times. It's sold as a reddish dried fruit that found in many Middle Eastern and Greek groceries in the form of a brick."

**** Chicken Shawerma: first blood II

Pulled the rare "back-to-backer" with madre y padre in town, Thursday featured the usual suspect... an ode to spicy lamb shawerma bliss (1st time asking for it "extra spicy" which produced a tongue salivating pleasure-to-pain ratio of about 4-1, perfect) that delighted all but the Stagecoach inn maid. Friday was the dreaded day of reckoning... 

Much like an understood mistress, I'd always known that there was this "other" shawerma,  yet I had always found myself inescapably blinded to variety by my craving for their grilledlamb. I had hoped  against hope that these poultry "infidels" were merely an option on tuesdays and fridays.... negative ghostrider. 

It's pollo time.... shiznit.... woe is me.... 
But wait, it has a "garlic yogurt" sauce replacing the tahini.... very interesting... hope springs eternal.

Verdict: while a breezy, almost sultry afternoon on Treasure Island sprung for extremely complimentary ambiance, the chicken shawerma failed to live up to the limited hype I had bestowed upon it. Even with the always appreciated extra red sauce, the lack of flavor depth in the chicken (through no fault of Truly Med) even as enhanced with garlic, could not hold a candle to its Baa Baa Black Sheep compatriot. 

lesson learned: while variety is indeed the spice of life, habitual use of sumac applied to a lamb burrito from the gods can make everyday remarkable.

excerpts: Even speaking about their falafel, chicken & lamb kababs,  and Chicken Shawerma (Fridays) makes me a little sad.
Nothing really compares to Truly Mediterranean.
chicken shawerma.author: Geek P.
chicken shawerma.review: OK,  when I moved to the Santa Cruz Area, from San Francisco in 2000, I went through a horrible break-up with  "Truly Mediterranean" (16th and Valencia).  I still have not had a falafel that is better than this.  Even speaking about their falafel, chicken & lamb kababs,  and Chicken Shawerma (Fridays) makes me a little sad.  Nothing really compares to Truly Mediterranean.

excerpts: The best chicken shawerma (spelling varies, but since they make the best, I spell it like they do) in the universe.
For some reason it's only available on Tuesday and Friday.
I used to drive over from the East Bay and bring them back for lunch.
Oh yeah, their falafel deluxe is good too, maybe the best outside of Israel, but if it's a Chicken Shawerma day I can't be bothered with anything else!
" -- that's a crappy chicken shawerma made by an all-Mexican staff playing salsa music.
It was NOT GOOD.
Truly Mediterranean is no longer True or Mediterranean.
chicken shawerma.author: Ian G.
chicken shawerma.review:
The best chicken shawerma (spelling varies, but since they make the best, I spell it like they do) in the universe.  For some reason it's only available on Tuesday and Friday.  I used to drive over from the East Bay and bring them back for lunch.  The other days they have lamb shawerma, which I ordered once and never again.  Don't they understand it's the chicken they excel at?  I totally agree with the comment "I have driven with my knees to scarf down this meal."  In fact, I also add a little improvised placemat to catch any drippings that may seep out the bottom of the foil wrapper.  Oh yeah, their falafel deluxe is good too, maybe the best outside of Israel, but if it's a Chicken Shawerma day I can't be bothered with anything else!

UPDATE: I ate here again after a long absence, and they made me a "shawerrito" -- that's a crappy chicken shawerma made by an all-Mexican staff playing salsa music. It was NOT GOOD. Truly Mediterranean is no longer True or Mediterranean.

excerpts: Their Chicken Shawerma is prepared almost lovingly with broiled tomatoes and seasoned onions in this garlic yoga sauce.
YES, child.
chicken shawerma.author: Michelle S.
chicken shawerma.review:
Such a pleasure to recommend this spot, a recent discovery for me being relatively new to SF. My friend, an entrenched native who knows nothing but good eats and swears by this place dragged me in here one Friday and omg = amazing treat.  Although I won't eat any red meat like lamb, the hummus here is unreal.  Best I've ever had.  One bite will have you in a happy haze of palate ecstasy with its creamy, tangy supreme deliciousness, wow....   
Their Chicken Shawerma is prepared almost lovingly with broiled tomatoes and seasoned onions in this garlic yoga sauce. YES, child.   And the giant portion sizes are definitely more than one meal. 

Also* no sleepin on the sweets either, everyone loves the baklava but one has to ask about the chocolaty delight they sell right next to that.  

Very affordable especially considering you will have leftovers to enjoy.

excerpts: My chicken shawerma was flavorful (with real grilled tomatoes, and lots of cilantro), but it also cost me $7.50.
chicken shawerma.author: Dave K.
chicken shawerma.review:
I don't know if I would call this place cheap. My chicken shawerma was flavorful (with real grilled tomatoes, and lots of cilantro), but it also cost me $7.50. I wasn't unsatisfied by any means, but beware that this ain't no $3 gyro joint. 

Go on a sunny day and eat at one of the two small tables set up on the sidewalk. Oh, and don't forget to add in the feta cheese. It really makes a difference!

excerpts: The Chicken Shawerma and the Falafel Deluxe is what it's all about!!!
I don't eat Lamb but friends have told me it's to die for!
Not really a place to sit and eat at....very limited seating.
This is a more take out type of place.
This is the one place to not miss out on!
chicken shawerma.author: Matt C.
chicken shawerma.review: If you want one of the best hole in the wall places...this is it!!! I dream about the food...if that tells you anything! Hah! The prices are very reasonable! ($5.00 to $7.00) It doesn't get any better than that! It's cheaper than fast food and a lot healthier!!! The Chicken Shawerma and the Falafel Deluxe is what it's all about!!! I don't eat Lamb but friends have told me it's to die for! Not really a place to sit and eat at....very limited seating. This is a more take out type of place. This is the one place to not miss out on!

excerpts: Got the chicken shawerma (with hot sauce, of course).
Once again, lived up to expectations..and in fact, I like the chicken more than the lamb.
chicken shawerma.author: Rona J.
chicken shawerma.review:
Yesterday marked my 3rd visit to Truly Med since I was first introduced a month ago. Credits go to the BF who have been frequenting here for quite some time. 

The first time there, I ordered a lamb shawerma and chose to eat it there--on the cushioned stools, facing the mirror. Being a complete newbie, I didn't realize that there was only one correct end to open the tin foil. I opened mine from the bottom (wrong side).  Just when I was about the dive in, the cashier quickly caught my attention, and rushed over to re-wrap my shawerma with tin foil. The top (correct end) is open, you see, and had the cashier not saved me, I would have been left with bits of lamb, yogurt sauce, onions, etc. falling onto on my lap. Great service--even from behind the counter! The shawerma was delicious with just the right amount of seasoning and tenderness of the meat. 

The second time, I got the lamb shawerma again. Opened it up from the top end. No mishaps there except the mess I made from devouring the thing.

Yesterday, my third time, I was lucky enough to go on a chicken day (Tuesdays and Fridays). Got the chicken shawerma (with hot sauce, of course). Once again, lived up to expectations..and in fact, I like the chicken more than the lamb. Need to make a mental note to visit more frequently on chicken days. 

Make sure to get the hot sauce! Always. 

And remember, even though this place is in the Mission, the shawerma isn't a burrito. That means...there is only one correct end to eat it from.

excerpts: Worth the trip from anywhere on a Tuesday or Friday for Chicken Shawerma, the rest of the week, have the Lamb Shawerma and a Ginger Beer.
chicken shawerma.author: Mark W.
chicken shawerma.review: Worth the trip from anywhere on a Tuesday or Friday for Chicken Shawerma, the rest of the week, have the Lamb Shawerma and a Ginger Beer.

excerpts: This place makes the BEST Chicken Shawerma I have EVER had!
It is worth the close to 9 dollars and then some.
I order mine with no onions...
I am allergic... and EXTRA hot sauce.
I have no idea what the sauce is made with
but it is the best hot sauce/paste EVER!!!!
They only make chicken on Tuesdays and Fridays... and I reserve 1 day a month to get one.
I can't say enough on how good these are...
even the tomatoes are nice and firm.
It is a no frills place... just get your food and eat it on a stool
our on some plastic chairs outside.
You can always get it to go...
but I can't wait that long to eat it!
chicken shawerma.author: Amelia M.
chicken shawerma.review: This place makes the BEST Chicken Shawerma I have EVER had! It is worth the close to 9 dollars and then some. I order mine with no onions... I am allergic... and EXTRA hot sauce. I have no idea what the sauce is made with but it is the best hot sauce/paste EVER!!!! They only make chicken on Tuesdays and Fridays... and I reserve 1 day a month to get one.  I can't say enough on how good these are... even the tomatoes are nice and firm. It is a no frills place... just get your food and eat it on a stool our on some plastic chairs outside. You can always get it to go... but I can't wait that long to eat it!

excerpts: Chicken shawerma wasn't as awesome but still decent.
Stick to the lamb, IMHO.
chicken shawerma.author: Desmo K.
chicken shawerma.review: Chicken shawerma wasn't as awesome but still decent.  Stick to the lamb, IMHO.

excerpts: I went with the Chicken Kabob, it was ok, but nothing like the Chicken Shawerma which is only aviailable on Tues and Fridays.
Im still giving the spot a 4 star since Ive been there so many times and consistantly have great meals.
chicken shawerma.author: Schmitty G.

chicken shawerma.author: Jessica L.
chicken shawerma.review:
The spicy sauce "dries out" the shawerma a bit, because it is more pasty than a thick chili liquid, which on the plus side doesn't soak through the wrap and therefore holds well when taking out, but I think next time I'll ask for extra yogurt sauce, which was divine. The meat was succulent--you can see them carve it out of a heaping mound on their rotating spit; just watching it and absorbing all the aroma... mouth watering! The rest of the filling is standard and very complementary; I love what they use for the wrap. Versus a pita or tortilla-esque wrap like some other places, they put it on lavash, a first for me. Awesome, perfect wrapping material.
Reasonable pricing for dinner fare, about $8 for a lamb shawerma; service is speedy and very friendly, and the place is immaculate for an over-the-counter eatery.
I agree with Giedon K. that this is a Take-Out only place; the stool and bar for "seating" are far too few and cramped to be able to truly enjoy your meal (plus it's a little weird to stare into a mirror and watch yourself scarf down food... it's almost like you're having an eating contest with yourself?).
Food a-plenty, I will be back for sure, especially to try out the chicken shawerma which is only served twice a week and therefore, makes it mysterious and worthy of my curiosity.

Hmm, i'm in the hunt for a good donner kebab replacement, and the lamb shawerma was going to be it.  It was good, though, I must admit it didn't bowl me over for a five star rating.  and didn't hit the donner kebab spot. The 3.5- 4 star partly for the food, esp that they ask you if you want it spicy, and also that they're quick and no fuss.  Actually, I think i would have been perfectly happy if they cut my lamb off the skewer (false advertising!), instead of using the precut stuff, and if my lamb was a little less fatty...

The place is really more of a quick stop sort of place, but I see huge potential for late night drunk food.  I bet the chicken shawerma is better than the lamb, but apparently they only serve it on Tues and Fri.  That's silly, i'm sure they could buy another machine and have both...

Next time i'll have to give the falafels a try, maybe that'll give it another star...

chicken shawerma.review: Truly Med is a great cheap eats place. Friendly people, decent food, not too expensive... I guess I can't complain, but the flavor didn't WOW me. Anyways, the FALAFEL here is VERY VERY good, I like how they put sesame seeds on the outside so it doesn't lose that crispy texture even when it's been sitting there for a little bit (as we all know Falafel is best eaten fresh out of the fryer). The babaghanoush was good, hummus was good, but wasn't that huge of a fan of their tabbouleh or dolma. I got the chicken shawerma - the hot sauce was great, but the chicken wasn't that strong on their seasonings (I just wanted to put more & more & more hot sauce on). I liked how they grilled their pita, but if I was going to force rank this mediterranean cheap eats, I'd say it wasn't the top of my list.

Filled with cooked tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, yogurt sauce and spicy, but not hot, chicken, for fast food, this may be the best option in town.

excerpts: In a very lamb-y mood, I ordered the Lamb Shawerma and Lamb Kabab (both with extra hot sauce.)
The lamb shawerma had thin slices of lamb and beef with broiled tomatoes, onions, and tahini sauce.
The lamb kabab was charbroiled marinated cubes of lamb leg with tomatoes, onions, salad, and tahini sauce.
Although the two sound exactly the same, they were distinguishable.
For all of the spicy food lovers out there, the hot sauce here is not a joke; it is spicy.
I also ordered a falafel and two dolma, which were all delicious.

What I recommend:
-- Lamb Kabab with extra hot sauce
lamb kabab.author: Andrew W.
lamb kabab.review:
I did not have high hopes for Truly Mediterranean, but it surpassed my expectations. The wraps at Truly Mediterranean had all of the flavor I love neatly wrapped up in a transportable package

In a very lamb-y mood, I ordered the Lamb Shawerma and Lamb Kabab (both with extra hot sauce.) The lamb shawerma had thin slices of lamb and beef with broiled tomatoes, onions, and tahini sauce. The lamb kabab was charbroiled marinated cubes of lamb leg with tomatoes, onions, salad, and tahini sauce. Although the two sound exactly the same, they were distinguishable. For all of the spicy food lovers out there, the hot sauce here is not a joke; it is spicy. I also ordered a falafel and two dolma, which were all delicious. Truly Mediterranean is quick, inexpensive place to grab a very filling and very spicy lunch.

What I recommend:
-- Lamb Kabab with extra hot sauce

excerpts: TM's chicken kabab wrap is humongous.
I ate it for lunch as soon as I got home that afternoon, as a snack after I finished my errands for the day (mainly packing for my Paris trip), and the remainder as a late dinner.
chicken kabab.author: Fancypants X.
chicken kabab.review:
Mediterranean/Middle Eastern/Greek food is in my top 5 most favorite eats (but you guys probably already knew that.) Please excuse my ignorant, non-PC ass; I lump these cuisines together cuz I don't know no bettah. 

Confession time: I do not dine out alone. Ever. It's part insecurity, part discomfort (brought on by said insecurity), so I took my edibles to-go instead of taking up one of their five counter seats. 

TM's chicken kabab wrap is humongous. I ate it for lunch as soon as I got home that afternoon, as a snack after I finished my errands for the day (mainly packing for my Paris trip), and the remainder as a late dinner. I have to say--the lavash held up nicely & didn't get super soggy as the day wore on. 

The spicy sauce worked deliciously well with the rest of the filling. Loved how the heat is slowly extinguished by the corresponding cooling taste of tahini & cucumbers. 

4.5 stars for a yummy, under $10 lunch (which lasted til dinner.)

excerpts: Had the Chicken Kabab and a taste of the Lamb Shawerma.
Both delicious.
Uber friendly staff.
chicken kabab.author: Jenny X.
chicken kabab.review: This place was good. Had the Chicken Kabab and a taste of the Lamb Shawerma. Both delicious. Uber friendly staff.

excerpts: *Kefta Kabab Plate: Seasoned ground lamb and sirloin, charbroiled to perfection, served with rice, hummus, and tabouleh ($13.20)
kefta kabab.author: Elena N.
kefta kabab.review:
Office lunch, part two. I ordered breakfast from another place, but knew I'd want more food. Since I had $20 to play with, I decided to order a wrap from Truly Mediterranean. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on Friday, February 9th around 12:30pm.

*Hummus Wrap: Garbanzo dip, tomatoes, parsley, onions, olive oil, and tahini sauce, served on lavash, Vegetarian ($7.15), add Tabuleh (+$1.10)
*Kefta Kabab Plate: Seasoned ground lamb and sirloin, charbroiled to perfection, served with rice, hummus, and tabouleh ($13.20)

I got the hummus wrap, but a coworker was nice enough to share his kebab plate. The wrap was actually huge! A good amount of hummus filling. Though it was a little thinner than I prefer. Kinda runny with all the ingredients mixed together. And messy to eat. Definitely a knife and fork situation. I had added tabbouleh, but unfortunately, I never got it. Good thing I had the plate since it came with tabbouleh. I love the freshness it adds to Mediterranean food. The tried the kofta which was okay. A bit dry, but the hummus helped with that when I ate them together.

Decent Mediterranean food. Though I'm bummed they forgot my tabbouleh. A waste of $1+. Not sure if it was Caviar or the restaurant's fault, but at least I had that back up plate. Glad I tried this spot, but I've had better.

excerpts: I had a kefta kabab sandwich which was pretty damn awesome.
It took a really long time (15 minutes) for them to prepare it
but it was worth it.
It's kinda different eating falafels in lavash as opposed to pita
but I liked the crispy texture.
It was tasty, spicy (but not too spicy) and really huge.
kefta kabab.author: Shyam P.
kefta kabab.review:
I had a kefta kabab sandwich which was pretty damn awesome.  It took a really long time (15 minutes) for them to prepare it but it was worth it.  It's kinda different eating falafels in lavash as opposed to pita but I liked the crispy texture.  It was tasty, spicy (but not too spicy) and really huge.  Can't beat that for $6.

The place is really small, has a counter and a couple tables outside, that's about it.

kefta kabab.review:
I really wanted to like this place, I'd kill for a good shawerma. I kept going back and trying different things - lamb shawerma, kefta kabab, falafel - none were bad, they were just all boring and tasteless. After a few tries I'm giving up.

I don't know where all these good reviews are coming from. I guess everyone is eating here drunk? If I'd been drunk I probably would have liked it too.

excerpts: Collectively we ordered the lamb shawerma, lamb kabob, and the Athens burger.
I ate the lamb shawerma, but tried the other two items.
My only complaint is that our order took FOREVER, because of the Athens Burger.
I don't fault them though, because the guy told us 15-20 minutes for that item, so we were forewarned.
I will not penalize.
The cooks were very polite, and seemed to genuinely care about the food and its quality.
During my wait, one of them asked me how my day was going
The Athens burger is not a traditional burger, but ground sirloin stuffed in a pita pocket.
athens burger.author: Brandon N.
athens burger.review:
Omg, the LAMB, the LAMMMMMMB.

I was with two others. Collectively we ordered the lamb shawerma, lamb kabob, and the Athens burger. I ate the lamb shawerma, but tried the other two items.

My only complaint is that our order took FOREVER, because of the Athens Burger. I don't fault them though, because the guy told us 15-20 minutes for that item, so we were forewarned. I will not penalize. The cooks were very polite, and seemed to genuinely care about the food and its quality. During my wait, one of them asked me how my day was going and if I wanted something to eat/drink while I waited.

The LaMBBBBbbBBb. It was fantastic, freshly sliced, and not dry. I attribute this to the joint being super busy on a Saturday night. My shawerma was incredible. There was so much meat packed into the perfectly crisp flatbread, accented with awesome tomatoes and an INCREDIBLE tahini sauce. I ate my shawerma outside, and the ground looked like a Jackson Pollock painting - tahini sauce spackling the cement. I devoured it with extreme prejudice.

The Athens burger is not a traditional burger, but ground sirloin stuffed in a pita pocket. It was fantastic.

I am a fan of the Mediterranean burritos served at this fine establishment. I'm glad I came on a lamb night. There was some crazy fighting that happened a bit down the road too, which provided some mid-meal entertainment.

For what it is: Mediterranean-on-the-fly, this place is superb.

excerpts: The Athens burger is a good twist on a traditional burger (wrap with cucumber), and moist & tasty.
Place is small, so not really
a sit down w/ friends.
athens burger.author: Stan L.
athens burger.review: Love the lamb shawerma - tender with a kick! The Athens burger is a good twist on a traditional burger (wrap with cucumber), and moist & tasty. Place is small, so not really a sit down w/ friends.

excerpts: My wife had the Athens Burger rolled up in a Lavash, and I think that was better than my meal.
athens burger.author: Miguel V.
athens burger.review:
This wasn't the best Schwarma I have ever had. It was actually a little bland. My wife had the Athens Burger rolled up in a Lavash, and I think that was better than my meal. I don't travel to the mission often, but when I do I want to be excited about what I'm eating, and that just didn't happen this time.  

Sorry 7 x 7... you let me down on this one!

excerpts: please don't be afraid of the Athens Burger in a Pocket.
athens burger.author: Tomas V.
athens burger.review:
goooooooooooooooood stuff.

please don't be afraid of the Athens Burger in a Pocket. It's f*ckin RAD!

Another Mission/Valencia place that's decently priced in an overpriced, overhyped neighborhood. 

Thank you [insert correct deity here] for Truly Mediterranean!

excerpts: The combo plate comes with falafel, cucumber, hummus, baba ghannoush, tabouleh, dolmas, feta, onions, tahini, hot sauce, and pita for about $11.
Good any-time meal.
Limited seating.
Good location and good for takeout.
baba ghannoush.author: D B.
baba ghannoush.review:
Love this place!

The lamb shawarma is a big hot meaty juicy mess.  The chicken isn't bad and falafel is great.  The combo plate comes with falafel, cucumber, hummus, baba ghannoush, tabouleh, dolmas, feta, onions, tahini, hot sauce, and pita for about $11.  Good any-time meal.  Limited seating.  Good location and good for takeout.

excerpts: The Baba Ghannoush and the falafel were my favorites, but everything in the platter was great.
I only wish there was more pita to go with the combo plate.
I thought the shawerma was perfect.
The wrap was crispy on the outside and everything on the inside was evenly distributed and melded together perfectly.
baba ghannoush.author: Stephen C.
baba ghannoush.review: I'm by no means an expert on Mediterranean food, but the taste of everything was delicious. I got the Combo plate and the Lamb Shawerma and both were delicious. The Baba Ghannoush and the falafel were my favorites, but everything in the platter was great. I only wish there was more pita to go with the combo plate. I thought the shawerma was perfect. The wrap was crispy on the outside and everything on the inside was evenly distributed and melded together perfectly.

excerpts: My favorite is the feta sandwich with eggplant:)
feta sandwich.author: Momo A.
feta sandwich.review: I have been going to truly med for over 10 years and I have never been disappointed. They make great food from great ingredients. They are friendly and polite and quick. There is no question they have the best Mediterranean food in the city (that I have tried). My favorite is the feta sandwich with eggplant:)

excerpts: Had the feta sandwich and my wife had the deluxe felafel.
Usually when you are served gigantic portions there is a loss of quality.
Not here.
Gigantic and fantastic throughout.
Service was fast and  friendly.
In hearing to the Mission district and Truly Mediterranean any time I'm in San Francisco.
feta sandwich.author: J S.
feta sandwich.review: This place is fantastic. Had the feta sandwich and my wife had the deluxe felafel. Usually when you are served gigantic portions there is a loss of quality. Not here.  Gigantic and fantastic throughout. Service was fast and  friendly. In hearing to the Mission district and Truly Mediterranean any time I'm in San Francisco.

excerpts: Feta sandwich was good too!
It's a small place, but workers there are friendly and fast.
I'm not expect with mediterranean food, but this one is a winner!
feta sandwich.author: Claire J.
feta sandwich.review: Love this place.  When we want good mediterranean food at work, we drive to here.  Mind you, we work in Daly City and will drive all the way there.  I've tried a lot of their dishes.  Some things I didn't like just because of my preference like tabouleh, I just never liked that.  But as for shawarma, kabob, etc.?  Good stuff over here!  Love their falafel, fresh and tasty!!!!!  hummus is awesome-ly good, although I prefer mine more lemon-y, but I know each place makes their own different.  Dolma was good too, the best I've had!  Feta sandwich was good too!  It's a small place, but workers there are friendly and fast.  I'm not expect with mediterranean food, but this one is a winner!

excerpts: Love the feta sandwich.
Only a few seats inside at the counter and maybe one or two tables outside, so be prepared to get it to go.
feta sandwich.author: Veena S.
feta sandwich.review:
yummy and cheap! their hummus is very tasty. Love the feta sandwich. 
Only a few seats inside at the counter and maybe one or two tables outside, so be prepared to get it to go.

excerpts: I walk a long way just to get their dolma sandwich.
[I went to ali baba recently (was desperate for some falafel and don't recommend them) and there they said they couldn't put dolmas on my sandwich...even though they have them right there...?!!).
Love the tiny space.
Folks are always nice.
Food is always great!
dolma sandwich.author: Lisa A.
dolma sandwich.review: Love this place.  I walk a long way just to get their dolma sandwich.  [I went to ali baba recently (was desperate for some falafel and don't recommend them) and there they said they couldn't put dolmas on my sandwich...even though they have them right there...?!!).  Love the tiny space.  Folks are always nice.  Food is always great!

excerpts: Ordered the  Mediterranean Combo Plate.
It was above average in flavor.
Good portions.
The pita was soft with good chew.
TM takes pride in their food.
The hot sauce that comes with it, is money.
I can't think of what I would change or make suggestions.
I give the food 4.5 stars.
Did not evaluate the service and dining room, as I ordered through food delivery.
High marks for the dish i ordered.
Good vegetarian option!
mediterranean combo plate.author: John B.
mediterranean combo plate.review:
Ordered the  Mediterranean Combo Plate. It was above average in flavor. Good portions. The pita was soft with good chew. TM takes pride in their food. The hot sauce that comes with it, is money.
I can't think of what I would change or make suggestions.
I give the food 4.5 stars. Did not evaluate the service and dining room, as I ordered through food delivery. High marks for the dish i ordered. Good vegetarian option!

excerpts: I got the Chicken shawarma, and my friends got a mediterranean combo plate, but neither of us liked it.
The place is also a hole in the wall, so there's not a lot of place to stand while you're waiting for your order.
mediterranean combo plate.author: Arjan N.
mediterranean combo plate.review:
I tried this again with a few friends, and got bit again - food was not good at all, could barely finish it. I got the Chicken shawarma, and my friends got a mediterranean combo plate, but neither of us liked it.
The place is also a hole in the wall, so there's not a lot of place to stand while you're waiting for your order.

excerpts: Tried the eggplant shawerma the mediterranean combo plate and both were delicious!!
Good for vegetarian~
mediterranean combo plate.author: Yennie L.
mediterranean combo plate.review: Tried the eggplant shawerma the mediterranean combo plate and both were delicious!! Good for vegetarian~

excerpts: Stopped by today and picked up a lamb shawarma and Mediterranean combo plate.
mediterranean combo plate.author: Rich L.
mediterranean combo plate.review:
Stopped by today and picked up a lamb shawarma and Mediterranean combo plate. Both were fantastic and the falafels...mmm.

Very friendly staff and they take pride in their food. I would definitely recommend.

excerpts: Given my flexitarian desires, I went for the $9.50 Mediterranean Combo Plate which sounded heavenly - falafel, hummus, babaganoush, tabouleh, diced cucumber salad, dolmas, feta cheese, seasoned onions, tahini and pita bread (see photo).
mediterranean combo plate.author: Ed U.
mediterranean combo plate.review:
I have to admit I don't get the love for this place. Jamie W. and I came here and realized as soon as we walked in that this is targeted to the budget-conscious hipster, preferably skinny ones since space is at a premium in this closet of a place. It reminds me of any number of places you would find around a college campus except that the prices have been very much Mission-ized. You can tell it has a devoted following because people came in and ordered what they wanted without a moment's thought.

Since I had to peruse the overhead menu (see menu), I felt the heavy impatient sighs behind me as well as the dead stare of the servers who gave me severe small-mouth. OK OK, relax... Given my flexitarian desires, I went for the $9.50 Mediterranean Combo Plate which sounded heavenly - falafel, hummus, babaganoush, tabouleh, diced cucumber salad, dolmas, feta cheese, seasoned onions, tahini and pita bread (see photo). It was all there in a takeout tray ready to devour, and for the most part, it was solid.

The falafel balls were probably the best feature especially when I dipped them into the hummus. The dolmas and the cucumber salad, on the other hand, tasted like they were in the fridge a bit too long, and the babganoush was quite oily. Jamie went for their specialty, the $7.15 Falafel Wrap, which he deemed decent but nothing outstanding (see photo). Eating at the counter was something of a joke since we were constantly elbowed and battered by handbags. Good times.

FOOD - 3 stars...decent enough Mediterranean food but nothing that stood out to us
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...like dining in an elevator where people are coming in and out at every floor
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...efficient but on the surly side
TOTAL - 3 stars...lackluster and claustrophobic, not my favorite Mediterranean combination

excerpts: The Mediterranean combo plate is enough for 2 people.
The prices are very fair for the amount and quality you get.
I've tried other greek/Mediterranean places in town, and always wish I was eating here instead.
And the extra roasted eggplant added to dishes...
So tasty!
mediterranean combo plate.author: Sarah K.
mediterranean combo plate.review: I love everything I've ever eaten here!  It's fresh and delicious with huge portions.  And the staff here is always super friendly.  Both chicken and lamb shwarma are equally good. The Mediterranean combo plate is enough for 2 people. The prices are very fair for the amount and quality you get.  I've tried other greek/Mediterranean places in town, and always wish I was eating here instead.   And the extra roasted eggplant added to dishes...So tasty!

excerpts: My girlfriend and I typically split the Lamb Shawerma and Mediterranean Combo Plate, it's the perfect mix of flavors and textures for two people.
Very authentic and juicy, plus the owner is super friendly and the food is prepared quickly.
Don't bother with the other Mediterranean restaurants on Valencia, come here!
mediterranean combo plate.author: Bud L.
mediterranean combo plate.review: Best Mediterranean to-go food in San Francisco.  It doesn't look like much from the outside, but you owe it to yourself to try this place if you're in the Mission.  My girlfriend and I typically split the Lamb Shawerma and Mediterranean Combo Plate, it's the perfect mix of flavors and textures for two people.  Very authentic and juicy, plus the owner is super friendly and the food is prepared quickly.  Don't bother with the other Mediterranean restaurants on Valencia, come here!

excerpts: I typically order the Mediterranean Combo Plate which comes with a Falafel, hummus, baba, tabouleh, cucumber salad, dolmas, feta cheese, seasoned onions, tahini sauce, and pita bread.
I order this almost everytime
mediterranean combo plate.author: Rebekah T.
mediterranean combo plate.review:
This is one of my favorite places to go for a little Mediterranean food. It's a tiny little place with a counter and not much else, but truly a gem in the Mission.

I typically order the Mediterranean Combo Plate which comes with a Falafel, hummus, baba, tabouleh, cucumber salad, dolmas, feta cheese, seasoned onions, tahini sauce, and pita bread. I order this almost everytime I'm here, because I love it. 

I also like the Chicken Shawerma, but you have to be lucky enough to come on a Tuesday or Friday, because those are the only days they have chicken. 

What I love about this place is while we are hanging out at Killowatt watching the game, we pop over and get the plate to go. It's a perfect appetizer for a group of hungry Giants fans.

excerpts: Also got a Mediterranean combo plate for dinner, it looks so yummy.
mediterranean combo plate.author: Tracy L.
mediterranean combo plate.review: So Happy, the falafel is just as wonderful as I remember. Haven't been here in years, because of parking & traffic issues. However I will be back soon with a driver. Great service, fast and easy. Also got a Mediterranean combo plate for dinner, it looks so yummy.

excerpts: I go for the Lamb Shawerma and the Mediterranean combo plate.
mediterranean combo plate.author: Mark C.
mediterranean combo plate.review: Great place. Friendly people. I go for the Lamb Shawerma and the Mediterranean combo plate.

excerpts: Mediterranean Combo Plate - an assortment of goodies... falafels, dolmas, baba ghannouj, tabouleh, hummus, cucumber salad, feta, seasoned onions, tahini, spicy sauce, and grilled pita.
mediterranean combo plate.author: Tiff W.
mediterranean combo plate.review:
Truly Mediterranean is a fantastic establishment - a gem, located in the heart of the Mission, and well worth any trip across town.

Their falafels are extraordinary, so far surpassing ordinary, that I find myself tongue-twisted, when I try to describe what objects of beauty they are. Crisp, chestnuty-burnt-russet-sienna outer spheres encompassing light, earthy-green treasures (sesame seeds, chickpeas, parsley, etc.) of "oh...wow," these perfect-sized nuggets are packed with natural, honest flavor. I love the way they smell and the way they sound a crunch, when I give them a gentle squeeze. A drizzle or dunk in tahini is an absolute must!

Lamb Shawerma - so much could go wrong, but they do it So Right. Spiced, moist, tangy, balanced: it's composed of tender, slow-roasted lamb and beef, broiled tomatoes, seasoned onions, fresh parsley, tahini, and spicy sauce all bundled up and hugged by grilled lavash.

Mediterranean Combo Plate - an assortment of goodies... falafels, dolmas, baba ghannouj, tabouleh, hummus, cucumber salad, feta, seasoned onions, tahini, spicy sauce, and grilled pita. Great to share with a friend!

Kind, personable, unassuming staff.
Fresh, consistent, authentic cuisine.
Reasonable prices (at 15cents/dolma, 40cents/falafel, etc..)

Thank goodness for the law of diminishing marginal utility, because if it weren't for her, I'd go much more often.

Truly Med, you have yet to fail me.

excerpts: I live nearby, and their falafel combo plate (Mediterranean Combo Plate) is a takeout staple for me.
mediterranean combo plate.author: Nisha P.
mediterranean combo plate.review:
Don't let the hole-in-the-wall ambiance fool you. The food is truly fresh and delicious - they make the best, freshest, falafel I have ever tasted, and I didn't think I was a falafel fan. I live nearby, and their falafel combo plate (Mediterranean Combo Plate) is a takeout staple for me. I actually haven't tried any of the meat because the falafel is so good! 

There is narrow counter to eat in, but I recommend getting take-out for home or the park. As I mentioned, ambiance is not Truly Mediterranean's strength.

excerpts: I got their mediterranean combo plate which comes with delicious hummus and baba ghannouj.
mediterranean combo plate.author: Elaine L.
mediterranean combo plate.review:
The falafels here are AMAZING! They are super crisp on the outside and you can literally hear the crunch if you press down on it. The inside is light and flavorful - delish!

I got their mediterranean combo plate which comes with delicious hummus and baba ghannouj. So good with pita and falafels and cucumber salad and tabouleh.

Their lamb shawerma is also very good. It comes with a large amount of juicy, tender meat, creamy hummus and spicy sauce. Just wonderful!

excerpts: We always get the Mediterranean combo plate as it has a little bit of everything.
mediterranean combo plate.author: Handoyo S.
mediterranean combo plate.review:
One of our go-to place when we're in need of a quick food. It's just 5-10 minutes away from our house and they always prepare the take-out order very quickly.

The falafel deserves all the fame it's getting. It's crispy and delicious. We always get the Mediterranean combo plate as it has a little bit of everything. The Baba Ghannouj (Eggplant paste) is great, as well as the hummus.

My personal favorite is the lamb shawerma though; it's the Greek's answer to burrito and I love lamb. It's spiced well and the hot sauce is amazing.

excerpts: I ordered the Mediterranean Combo plate - good variety, and everything else tasted great: dolma, tabouleh, cucumber salad, feta, baba ganoush, hummus, and pita (in addition to the falafel).

Hearty serving size, and good value for the price!
4.

Friendly service!  
5.
mediterranean combo plate.author: Alice C.
mediterranean combo plate.review:
Best.  Falafel.  Ever.  

HONGRY after a hard spinning workout and desperate for something non Mexican but still close to my house, Yelp led me here!

LIKES:
1. Falafel here is phenomenal!!
2. I ordered the Mediterranean Combo plate - good variety, and everything else tasted great: dolma, tabouleh, cucumber salad, feta, baba ganoush, hummus, and pita (in addition to the falafel).
3. Hearty serving size, and good value for the price!
4. Friendly service!  
5. Accepts credit cards! - Also a rare find in the Mission.

GRIPES:
1. It really is a hole in the wall, so there's not a ton of room to sit down and eat.  It's more of a take out place, but that being said, I got my food to go, and the falafel was still crispy on the outside, just the way I like it, 35 minutes later!

Blink and you'll miss it, but worth keeping your eyes (and your stomach) open for this delicious food!

excerpts: Went back and got a lamb shawerma and mediterranean combo plate.
They were good, though the meat was a bit tough and chewy.
But.
I change my mind about this place.
I'm gonna toss a couple extra stars their way.
mediterranean combo plate.author: Diana Y.
mediterranean combo plate.review:
Falafel Deluxe.
Exploded after 4 bites.
It was not tasty.  

I am sad.  

So I write haiku about my sadness.

*************************************
UPDATE: 06/28/2007

Went back and got a lamb shawerma and mediterranean combo plate.  They were good, though the meat was a bit tough and chewy.  But.  I change my mind about this place.  I'm gonna toss a couple extra stars their way.

excerpts: mediterranean combo plate for $8.50?
yes please.
easy in, easy out?

yes please.
crunchy hot falafel with sesame seeds?
yes,
mediterranean combo plate.author: Michelle K.
mediterranean combo plate.review:
definitely worth your money. 
mediterranean combo plate for $8.50? yes please.
easy in, easy out? yes please.
crunchy hot falafel with sesame seeds? yes, and yes please!

on a more detailed note, their baba ganoush was quite flavorful. i know a lot of mediterranean places can have a very bland baba ganoush. really delicious dolmas too :)

i'm definitely making this a regular take out spot.

excerpts: This place has the single best Shawarma (Chicken or Lamb), Mediterranean combo plate, and some of the best falafel I have ever had.
I eat here at least twice a month, so look for me cutting in line to order since you probably don't know exactly what you want.
mediterranean combo plate.author: Chris P.
mediterranean combo plate.review: Truly Mediterranean has never let me down.  In fact, they seem to be getting better!  Newly remodeled interior makes it much less intimidating for the uninitiated, and the food is as good if not better than before.  Don't let it's appearance fool you.  This place has the single best Shawarma (Chicken or Lamb), Mediterranean combo plate, and some of the best falafel I have ever had.  I eat here at least twice a month, so look for me cutting in line to order since you probably don't know exactly what you want.

excerpts: But yeah we probably shouldn't have ordered that side of hummus.
side of hummus.author: Esther A.
side of hummus.review:
Whoa these wraps are massive. Consuming just one of these wraps it looked as though I was going to hit my daily calorie intake on this one sitting. But yeah we probably shouldn't have ordered that side of hummus.

I have the deluxe and it was pretty satisfying. I did make an internal note to opt put of the eggplant next time (it was way smooshy and I didn't enjoy it) and request for non-spicy. Not because I can't handle spicy but because I didn't really care for the wrap to be as spicy as it was. But I was pleasantly surprised that my wrap had fries. Does this make the wrap not as "truly Mediterranean" as their name suggests? I don't know but I also don't care - it was good! 

Warning: it can get quite messy. The cubed cucumbers, they tend to fall out easily and there was a bit of excess dripping from my wrap; probably from the cucumber juice. 

Service was quick and swift. I ordered ahead and was told 10 minutes and they were good on their word.

excerpts: I also ordered a side of hummus and pita bread.
the table thought the hummus was perfect.
it had the right amount of garlic.
side of hummus.author: Alex F.
side of hummus.review:
Disclaimer: i got drunk after visiting here, so details are a little foggy and it is going on 2 weeks since i went.

So after a couple of drinks at Elixir, we decide to stumble down 16th. We can't really figure out what to eat and someone says "Doner" (they probably said something else and all I heard was Doner) and then my interest is peaked. I bust out the phone and risk running down the remaining 2% of battery I have to navigate us to some shawarmas. Lucky for us, we were 70 feet away from Truly Med. 

The ladies got the falafel wraps, Seb got the chicken wrap and I the lamb. The three of them said it tasted delish but that their food was dripping all over the place. I don't personally see a problem with this. In fact I think it is the way drunk food should be. My lamb shawarma was drippy too but I know how to eat and not make a mess and growing up, burritos were my favorite food item. So I know to not unwrap the bottom because then all the juice spills on your pants. (truly unprofessional)

The lamb was so good, I wanted to take it into the alley. 

I also ordered a side of hummus and pita bread. the table thought the hummus was perfect. it had the right amount of garlic. i'm sure it was not made in house but still credit for picking a good brand instead of something that helps your profit margin. 

I'm sorry for my friends in the Bay Area and my gf because whenever I got up there and hang in the Mission, we're going to have to eat Doners from Truly Med. every single meal.

excerpts: right now with a small side of hummus with pita, which is a very good size for the price (around 4 bucks).
Shawarma (roughly 8 bucks) is delicious with tender seasoned lamb, onions, spicy sauce/paste, and I'm guessing a yogurt sauce.
They toast it and the pita up on the grill.
The wrap could use cucumber
but otherwise no complaints.
First time here, next time I'll ask to add cucumbers :) awesome find, I definitely recommend it.
side of hummus.author: Courtney T.
side of hummus.review: I'm eating a lamb Schwarma (ok I know I totally spelled that wrong and I'm too lazy to check it lol) right now with a small side of hummus with pita, which is a very good size for the price (around 4 bucks). Shawarma (roughly 8 bucks) is delicious with tender seasoned lamb, onions, spicy sauce/paste, and I'm guessing a yogurt sauce. They toast it and the pita up on the grill. The wrap could use cucumber but otherwise no complaints. First time here, next time I'll ask to add cucumbers :) awesome find, I definitely recommend it.

excerpts: I had the lamb shawerma with a side of hummus.
The shawerma wrap was amazing.
It was very tasty and juicy.
The hummus was also very very good.
side of hummus.author: David C.
side of hummus.review:
I tried shawerma for the first time every today.  Me and a buddy of mine had to after watching "The Averngers".   I had the lamb shawerma with a side of hummus.  The shawerma wrap was amazing.  It was very tasty and juicy.  The hummus was also very very good.  I am a huge hummus fan, and this hummus is GOOD.

I would highly recommend this place to anyone!  Parking kinda sucks but that goes with just about anywhere in the city.  The staff were all friendly and the food was made up fast.  I will definitely go again.

excerpts: Sometimes I'll even just pop in for a side of hummus and pita - cheap, quick yumminess.
side of hummus.author: Stephanie P.
side of hummus.review:
Last night, a friend asked me, "You just lovvve being carniverous, dontcha Steph?" Well, I do, and my favorite of all meats is lamb.

But who can really afford to eat lamb on the regular? Me!

My roommate and I gorge ourselves on shwarma weekly. I go big and order the lamb shwarma and add hummus and cucumber salad to it. It's squishy and enormous and oh, just delicious. Sometimes I'll even just pop in for a side of hummus and pita - cheap, quick yumminess.

An added bonus is that the guys behind the counter always put a smile on my face... and that ain't just the lamb talkin.

excerpts: Both were amazing, usually with a side of hummus.
side of hummus.author: Chad G.
side of hummus.review:
I've had two things here--the Chicken Shawarma and that Chicken Kabob. Both were amazing, usually with a side of hummus. 

The only, one thing holding this place back from having to make yelp add another star? No seating, at least, only barely. I realize the space is teeny, so it can't detract realistically from the place's rating, but it would be nice to be able to sit indoors, look out onto 16th, and scarf on one of their pita wraps.

excerpts: Also, our friend ordered a side of hummus, and he got a nice-sized tub with enough to take home and share a snack with his girlfriend later.
side of hummus.author: Amber W.
side of hummus.review:
Yummy yummy.  My boyfriend and I were visiting friends in SF, as well as scouting it out as a potential place to live (we're from Indiana).  We were searching for falafel, as there's only one place to get it anywhere near our home.

The falafel here was HUGE.  I preferred it over Ali Baba's Cave.  I ordered the deluxe spicy, and my dude ordered the regular.  The spicy spread was awesome, with just a little bite to it.  Also, I'm an eggplant junkie, so I had to spring for the deluxe.  I could have done without the fries built into the wrap, but they weren't bad.  Also, our friend ordered a side of hummus, and he got a nice-sized tub with enough to take home and share a snack with his girlfriend later.  The staff was super-nice.  

The only thing I'm wondering is this:  what on earth is the "garlic-yogurt drink"?!  Is this good?  I couldn't bring myself to buy one, even out of curiosity.

excerpts: I ordered a side of hummus and it was underwhelming.
side of hummus.author: Ilya S.
side of hummus.review:
The lamb shawarma is huge and pretty tasty. No complaints. 

I ordered a side of hummus and it was underwhelming. Bland hummus and bland pita -- the dry floppy kind that you can get in any corner store.

That said, it's a tasty hole-in-the-wall with good portions. Recommended when you want to fill your stomach on the go.

excerpts: he perfect combo for me is the half a Deluxe and half a side of Tabouleh.
Bomb dot com dinner right there!
side of tabouleh.author: Helen V.
side of tabouleh.review:
BALLS!!!!

The Deluxe Falafel Schawerma makes me want to become a vegetarian.  What's meat? 

What attracted me to this place was actually the meat roasting in the window as you walk down 16th St. And I love meat.  So I went in and luckily, I had a friend with me so we ordered one Deluxe and one Chicken shawerma.  Surprisingly the chicken one was kinda dry but that's okay because the Deluxe makes up for it! This place seriously makes the best falafel balls I've ever had. I bring everyone here to try them. And add eggplant and potatoes YUMMM

Each Shawerma is sharable but easily capable of being devoured. he perfect combo for me is the half a Deluxe and half a side of Tabouleh.  Bomb dot com dinner right there! I just had one tonight...and I still want one tomorrow.

The staff is friendly and service is quick.  Prices are alright...$8/wrap...  Sucks that there's very minimal seating and not a good place for a "catch up" meal with friends.  But I'm willing to sacrifice! 

BALLS!!!!

excerpts: The dessert, Pistachio Baklava, deserves its own personal section.
Definitely pricey for a small block of goodness (almost as much as an order of falafel balls).
But it's so good, like a delicious sweet pistachio in between flakey layers of crunchy crepe.
I always have to get it even though it's so small and pricey.
pistachio baklava.author: Melanie T.
pistachio baklava.review:
Hole in the wall with amazing falafel balls!

One of the many restaurants down the street from the 16th bart station, so as usual I would never drive over here (parking is terrible). 

This place is tiny, like it can probably only hold 5-6 people tiny. Expect to grab and go unless you don't mind sitting alongside the wall with people waiting behind you for their food. (It's way too cramped for me!)

I always grab the falafels because they're big, delicious, and come with great sauces (a red spicy one and a white sauce). They're also really worth it for the price! My boyfriend loves the wraps, but they only offer specific meats on certain days! Make sure you check the menu before you head on in. ADD EGGPLANT - it is soooo delicious and it just upgrades the wrap to the next level LOL.

The dessert, Pistachio Baklava, deserves its own personal section. Definitely pricey for a small block of goodness (almost as much as an order of falafel balls). But it's so good, like a delicious sweet pistachio in between flakey layers of crunchy crepe. I always have to get it even though it's so small and pricey.

excerpts: The Lamb Shawarma is a delicious and the Pistachio Baklava is a yummy.
The staff is friendly and helpful.
The Lamb Shawarma Wrap is pricy but it's worth-it.
pistachio baklava.author: R R.
pistachio baklava.review: I would recommend this place Truly Mediterranean. The Lamb Shawarma is a delicious and the Pistachio Baklava is a yummy. The staff is friendly and helpful. The Lamb Shawarma Wrap is pricy but it's worth-it.

excerpts: And the pistachio baklava was excellent.......
pistachio baklava.author: Foodlover B.
pistachio baklava.review:
Ordered a deluxe falafel to go.  No potatoes, please!

Would you like hummus instead?

Why, yes, thank you.....

Delicious!

And the pistachio baklava was excellent.......

excerpts: The pistachio baklava were fresh tasting and very good- not so sweet that your tongue burns.
The only thing I wish I got were some beets!!!
I guess you have to ask for them???
pistachio baklava.author: Piper W.
pistachio baklava.review: Loved this. Tried the lamb and falafel wraps and both were excellent. Also tried the plate which was delicious. The hot sauce is good. The garlic mint yogurt drink was cool and good but more garlicky than the ones you get in the Middle East. The pistachio baklava were fresh tasting and very good- not so sweet that your tongue burns. The only thing I wish I got were some beets!!! I guess you have to ask for them???

excerpts: I think what really makes this place shine is their pistachio baklava.
pistachio baklava.author: Christopher K.
pistachio baklava.review:
"Do you want it for here or to go?"

I always love being asked that question in a place that seats precisely seven people.

This place mastered the spice blends and sauces to make some excellent wraps.  I think what really makes this place shine is their pistachio baklava.  It's scrumptious.

Truly Mediterranean is a wonderful quick bite establishment.  I almost called it "fast food".  I quickly changed my mind, as that would only invite unfavorable comparisons to terrible national burger chains.

excerpts: The desserts include walnut or pistachio baklava, never stale.
pistachio baklava.author: Nan L.
pistachio baklava.review:
Go for the specialties that Walid provides, this place is not a one trick pony. The yogurt garlic drink is awesome with the lamb shawerma, which turns on a spit. The desserts include walnut or pistachio baklava, never stale.

This place really is Mediterranean, unafraid to offer strong hearty flavors without dumbing them down for patrons from out of town of for the sake of adding in "Euro" blends, so it's not for the faint of heart. It's also a family operation and has been here for years. 

They do a good job catering also and pastries are made fresh for you. I got pastries made for my graduation and they were all eaten. Check it out!

excerpts: and of course, a piece of pistachio baklava to go for the late nite snacking
pistachio baklava.author: Yolanda L.
pistachio baklava.review:
yummy...came here on a sunday afternoon for a late lunch/snack. read many reviews about the place and since i've been craving mediterranean quick eats, this was the perfect place. tiny hole in the wall with cheap, decent prices..great for something on the go or to snack on right there. 
my bf and i ordered the combo plate (dolmas, hummus, babaganoush, pitas, tabouli salad, and cucumber salad)...it's a great combo plate for vegetarians and non-vegetarians as well! all the flavors were crisp, clean, and just damn plain GOOD!!
we also ordered a chicken kebab & shwarma....it was like a cross between a gyro/burrito...huge!! a great meal just by itself...after sharing the combo plate and munching on my chicken kebab gyro, i was too stuffed to finish it & took home the other half of my gyro thingy.
my bf had the shwaerma which was a mix of lamb and beef (sirloin i think?) and he ate the whole thing b/c it was soooo good. there was broiled tomatoes, tabouli salad, onions, tahini sauce & the meat all wrapped on lavash bread & then grilled again--wonderful crunchy, chewy pita type bread texture!!

and of course, a piece of pistachio baklava to go for the late nite snacking...that was good but a little too sweet for my taste (then again, i'm not much of a sweets person)

would i come back again? hell yes!!
